name: 10,000,000 Volt Thunderbolt
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: 10,000,000 Volt Thunderbolt is an Electric type Z-Move exclusive to Cap Pikachu. It is used with Thunderbolt. 10,000,000 Volt Thunderbolt deals damage and has a sharply increased critical hit ratio (1⁄2 instead of 1⁄24).

name: Absorb
description: A nutrient-draining attack. The user’s HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.
effect: Absorb deals damage and the user will recover 50% of the HP drained. If the user is holding a Big Root, the move instead recovers 65% of the damage dealt (30% more than normal). If used on a Pokémon with the ability Liquid Ooze, the user instead loses the HP it would have otherwise gained.

name: Accelerock
description: The user smashes into the target at high speed. This move always goes first.
effect: Accelerock deals damage and has high priority. Moves with a higher priority always go first, regardless of a Pokémon's speed. If two moves with the same priority are used, the faster Pokémon goes first as usual.

name: Acid
description: Opposing Pokémon are attacked with a spray of harsh acid. This may also lower their Sp. Def stats.
effect: Acid deals damage and has a 10% chance of lowering the target's Special Defense by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Acid Armor
description: The user alters its cellular structure to liquefy itself, sharply raising its Defense stat.
effect: Acid Armor raises the user's Defense by two stages. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Acid Downpour
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Acid Downpour is the Poison type Z-Move, introduced in Pokémon Sun/Moon.

name: Acid Spray
description: The user spits fluid that works to melt the target. This harshly lowers the target’s Sp. Def stat.
effect: Acid Spray inflicts damage and lowers the target's Special Defense by two stages. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Acrobatics
description: The user nimbly strikes the target. If the user is not holding an item, this attack inflicts massive damage.
effect: Acrobatics deals damage, however, if the user is not holding an item, its power doubles to 110. If the user is holding a Flying Gem, it is consumed before the Pokémon attacks, so it receives both boosts and increases Acrobatics' power to 143 (or 165 in Generation 5). Once the Gem is consumed Acrobatics' power for the rest of the battle will be 110.

name: Acupressure
description: The user applies pressure to stress points, sharply boosting one of its or its allies’ stats.
effect: Acupressure raises a random stat - Attack, Defense, Speed, Special Attack, Special Defense, Accuracy or Evasion - by two stages. It will always choose a stat that is not already maximized. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. Acupressure is unlike other status moves in that it can be targeted at itself or an adjacent teammate. It cannot be used on an ally if they are behind a Substitute, but the user can apply Acupressure to itself if behind a Substitute.

name: Aerial Ace
description: The user confounds the target with speed, then slashes. This attack never misses.
effect: Aerial Ace deals damage and ignores changes to the Accuracy and Evasion stats. However, it will not hit Pokémon during the invulnerable stage of Bounce, Dig, Dive, Fly, Shadow Force or Sky Drop.

name: Aeroblast
description: A vortex of air is shot at the target to inflict damage. Critical hits land more easily.
effect: Aeroblast deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio (1⁄8 instead of 1⁄16).

name: After You
description: The user helps the target and makes it use its move right after the user.
effect: After You forces the target to attack first in the next turn. It can be targeted at opponents or team-mates.

name: Agility
description: The user relaxes and lightens its body to move faster. This sharply raises the Speed stat.
effect: Agility raises the user's Speed by two stages. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Air Cutter
description: The user launches razor-like wind to slash opposing Pokémon. Critical hits land more easily.
effect: Air Cutter deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio (1⁄8 instead of 1⁄16).

name: Air Slash
description: The user attacks with a blade of air that slices even the sky. This may also make the target flinch.
effect: Air Slash deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved). Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.

name: All-Out Pummeling
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: All-Out Pummeling is the Fighting type Z-Move, introduced in Pokémon Sun/Moon.

name: Ally Switch
description: The user teleports using a strange power and switches places with one of its allies.
effect: In a triple battle, if the user is on either the left or right of the team (not in the middle), Ally Switch switches with the Pokémon on the other end of the team.

name: Amnesia
description: The user temporarily empties its mind to forget its concerns. This sharply raises the user’s Sp. Def stat.
effect: Amnesia raises the user's Special Defense by two stages. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Anchor Shot
description: The user entangles the target with its anchor chain while attacking. The target becomes unable to flee.
effect: The user entangles the target with its anchor chain while attacking. The target becomes unable to flee.

name: Ancient Power
description: The user attacks with a prehistoric power. This may also raise all the user’s stats at once.
effect: Ancient Power deals damage and has a 10% chance of raising all the user's stats at once - Attack, Defense, Special Attack, Special Defense and Speed - by one stage each. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Apple Acid
description: The user attacks the target with an acidic liquid created from tart apples. This also lowers the target’s Sp. Def stat.
effect: Lowers target's Special Defense.

name: Aqua Jet
description: The user lunges at the target at a speed that makes it almost invisible. This move always goes first.
effect: Aqua Jet deals damage and has a priority of +1. Moves with a higher priority always go first, regardless of a Pokémon's speed. If two moves with the same priority are used, the faster Pokémon goes first as usual.

name: Aqua Ring
description: The user envelops itself in a veil made of water. It regains some HP every turn.
effect: The user of Aqua Ring surrounds itself with a veil of water, which restores 1⁄16 of its maximum HP at the end of each turn. If the user is holding a Big Root, Aqua Ring restores 30% more HP each turn - approximately 1⁄12 of its maximum.

name: Aqua Tail
description: The user attacks by swinging its tail as if it were a vicious wave in a raging storm.
effect: Aqua Tail deals damage with no additional effect.

name: Arm Thrust
description: The user lets loose a flurry of open-palmed arm thrusts that hit two to five times in a row.

name: Aromatherapy
description: The user releases a soothing scent that heals all status conditions affecting the user’s party.
effect: Cures all status problems in your party.

name: Aromatic Mist
description: The user raises the Sp. Def stat of an ally Pokémon by using a mysterious aroma.
effect: Aromatic Mist raises the Special Defense of the user and its teammates by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Assist
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Assist uses a random move known by any of the user's party Pokémon. Assist will not select a Z-Move or any of the following moves:

name: Assurance
description: If the target has already taken some damage in the same turn, this attack’s power is doubled.
effect: Assurance deals damage, and if the target has already taken damage in this turn its power doubles to 120.

name: Astonish
description: The user attacks the target while shouting in a startling fashion. This may also make the target flinch.
effect: Astonish deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved). Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.

name: Attack Order
description: The user calls out its underlings to pummel the target. Critical hits land more easily.
effect: Attack Order deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio (1⁄8 instead of 1⁄16).

name: Attract
description: If it is the opposite gender of the user, the target becomes infatuated and less likely to attack.
effect: Attract causes Pokémon of the opposite gender to become infatuated. Infatuated Pokémon have a 50% chance of being immobilized by love each turn and unable to attack. Attract will fail on Pokémon of the same gender, genderless Pokémon and those with the ability Oblivious. Mew and Cryogonal can learn Attract via TM despite being genderless, however, the move will have no effect.

name: Aura Sphere
description: The user lets loose a blast of aura power from deep within its body at the target. This attack never misses.
effect: Aura Sphere deals damage and ignores changes to the Accuracy and Evasion stats. However, it will not hit Pokémon during the invulnerable stage of Bounce, Dig, Dive, Fly, Shadow Force or Sky Drop.

name: Aura Wheel
description: Morpeko attacks and raises its Speed with the energy stored in its cheeks. This move’s type changes depending on the user’s form.
effect: Aura Wheel is the signature move of Morpeko. It deals damage, but changes to Dark type when Morpeko is in Hangry Mode.

name: Aurora Beam
description: The target is hit with a rainbow-colored beam. This may also lower the target’s Attack stat.
effect: Aurora Beam deals damage and has a 10% chance of lowering the target's Attack by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Aurora Veil
description: This move reduces damage from physical and special moves for five turns. This can be used only in a hailstorm.
effect: Aurora Veil halves damage from Physical and Special attacks for five turns.

name: Autotomize
description: The user sheds part of its body to make itself lighter and sharply raise its Speed stat.
effect: Autotomize raises the user's Speed by two stages and reduces its weight by 100kg (to a minimum of 0.1kg). Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. Decreasing weight affects these moves:

name: Avalanche
description: The power of this attack move is doubled if the user has been hurt by the target in the same turn.
effect: Power doubles if user took damage first.

name: Baby-Doll Eyes
description: The user stares at the target with its baby-doll eyes, which lowers the target’s Attack stat. This move always goes first.
effect: Baby-Doll Eyes lowers the target's Attack by one stage, and moves with priority +1.

name: Baddy Bad
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Baddy Bad deals damage and reduces damage from Physical attacks by 50%, for 5 turns (similar to Reflect). Baddy Bad is an Eevee-exclusive tutor move from Pokémon Let's Go, along with Bouncy Bubble, Buzzy Buzz, Sizzly Slide, Glitzy Glow, Sappy Seed, Freezy Frost, and Sparkly Swirl.

name: Baneful Bunker
description: In addition to protecting the user from attacks, this move also poisons any attacker that makes direct contact.
effect: Baneful Bunker prevents any attacks targeted at the user from striking, for the duration of the turn. If a contact move is targeted at the Baneful Bunker user on that turn, the attacker becomes poisoned. It has priority +4 so will activate before most other moves. Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned. The effects do not stack with the Rocky Helmet item or the Rough Skin or Iron Barbs abilities. The accuracy of Baneful Bunker drops by 1⁄3 each time it is used consecutively after itself or Protect, Detect, Endure, Wide Guard, Quick Guard, Spiky Shield, or King's Shield.

name: Barrage
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.

name: Barrier
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Barrier raises the user's Defense by two stages. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Baton Pass
description: The user switches places with a party Pokémon in waiting and passes along any stat changes.
effect: Baton Pass causes the user to switch out for another Pokémon, passing any stat changes to the Pokémon that switches in. These effects are passed:

name: Beak Blast
description: The user first heats up its beak, and then it attacks the target. Making direct contact with the Pokémon while it’s heating up its beak results in a burn.
effect: The user first heats up its beak, and then it attacks the target. Making direct contact with the Pokémon while it's heating up its beak results in a burn.

name: Beat Up
description: The user gets all party Pokémon to attack the target. The more party Pokémon, the greater the number of attacks.
effect: Beat Up deals damage from each Pokémon on your team that does not have a status ailment (nor is fainted). Each strike has a different base power, calculated as:

name: Behemoth Bash
description: The user becomes a gigantic shield and slams into the target. This move deals twice the damage if the target is Dynamaxed.
effect: Damage doubles if user is Dynamaxed.

name: Behemoth Blade
description: The user becomes a gigantic sword and cuts the target. This move deals twice the damage if the target is Dynamaxed.
effect: Damage doubles if user is Dynamaxed.

name: Belch
description: The user lets out a damaging belch at the target. The user must eat a held Berry to use this move.
effect: Belch deals damage, but only works if the user has previously consumed a Berry during the battle. Manually feeding a Berry from the bag does not count.

name: Belly Drum
description: The user maximizes its Attack stat in exchange for HP equal to half its max HP.
effect: User loses 50% of its max HP, but Attack raises to maximum.

name: Bestow
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Bestow gives the user's held item to the target. It will not work if the target is already holding an item or is behind a Substitute. Mail cannot be transferred. Items bestowed upon wild Pokémon are permanently lost if the Pokémon is KO'd, but items lost in Trainer battles are returned. All held items in wi-fi/linked battles (including Battle Tower/Subway/Maison) are returned to their respective owners at the end of a battle. Pokemon with the ability Sticky Hold cannot have their held item removed. The Griseous Orb cannot be removed from Giratina; Type Plates cannot be removed from Arceus; Drives cannot be removed from Genesect; and Mega Stones cannot be removed from their respective Pokémon.

name: Bide
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: The user of Bide stores energy for 2 turns. At the end of the second turn the Pokémon unleashes energy, dealing twice the HP damage it received. Bide deals fixed, typeless damage, so will hit Ghost-type Pokémon. It also ignores changes to the Accuracy and Evasion stats and can hit Pokémon in the invulnerable stage of Bounce, Dig, Dive, Fly, Shadow Force or Sky Drop. In double and triple battles, Bide hits the last Pokémon to attack the user (including teammates).

name: Bind
description: Things such as long bodies or tentacles are used to bind and squeeze the target for four to five turns.
effect: Bind inflicts damage on the first turn then traps the opponent, causing them to lose 1⁄8 of their maximum HP after each turn, for 4-5 turns. If the user holds a Grip Claw, the after-effects last for 7 turns. If a Binding Band is held, the damage is 1⁄6 of the target's maximum HP.

name: Bite
description: The target is bitten with viciously sharp fangs. This may also make the target flinch.
effect: Bite deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved). Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.

name: Black Hole Eclipse
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Black Hole Eclipse is the Dark type Z-Move, introduced in Pokémon Sun/Moon.

name: Blast Burn
description: The target is razed by a fiery explosion. The user can’t move on the next turn.
effect: User must recharge next turn.

name: Blaze Kick
description: The user launches a kick that lands a critical hit more easily. This may also leave the target with a burn.
effect: Blaze Kick deals damage and has a 10% chance of burning the target. It also has an increased critical hit ratio (1⁄8 instead of 1⁄16). Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned. Pokémon with the abilities Battle Armor or Shell Armor are protected against critical hits.

name: Blizzard
description: A howling blizzard is summoned to strike opposing Pokémon. This may also leave the opposing Pokémon frozen.
effect: Blizzard deals damage and has a 10% chance of freezing the target. It will hit both opponents in a double battle or adjacent opponents in a triple battle. Ice type Pokémon, those with the ability Magma Armor or those behind a Substitute cannot be frozen. During a hailstorm, Blizzard ignores accuracy.

name: Block
description: The user blocks the target’s way with arms spread wide to prevent escape.
effect: Opponent cannot flee or switch.

name: Bloom Doom
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Bloom Doom is the Grass type Z-Move, introduced in Pokémon Sun/Moon.

name: Blue Flare
description: The user attacks by engulfing the target in an intense, yet beautiful, blue flame. This may also leave the target with a burn.
effect: Blue Flare deals damage and has a 20% chance of burning the target. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned.

name: Body Press
description: The user attacks by slamming its body into the target. The higher the user’s Defense, the more damage it can inflict on the target.
effect: The higher the user's Defense, the stronger the attack.

name: Body Slam
description: The user drops onto the target with its full body weight. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
effect: Body Slam deals damage and has a 30% chance of paralyzing the target. Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed. If the target has used Minimize, Body Slam ignores accuracy and deals double damage.

name: Bolt Beak
description: The user stabs the target with its electrified beak. If the user attacks before the target, the power of this move is doubled.
effect: If the user attacks before the target, the power of this move is doubled.

name: Bolt Strike
description: The user surrounds itself with a great amount of electricity and charges its target. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
effect: Bolt Strike deals damage and has a 20% chance of paralyzing the target. Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.

name: Bone Club
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Bone Club deals damage and has a 10% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved). Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.

name: Bone Rush
description: The user strikes the target with a hard bone two to five times in a row.

name: Bonemerang
description: The user throws the bone it holds. The bone loops around to hit the target twice—coming and going.
effect:
Bonemerang deals damage and will strike twice (with 50 base power each time).
Each strike of Bonemerang is treated like a separate attack:

name: Boomburst
description: The user attacks everything around it with the destructive power of a terrible, explosive sound.
effect: Boomburst deals massive damage and targets all adjacent Pokémon in battle, including allies.

name: Bounce
description: The user bounces up high, then drops on the target on the second turn. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
effect: The user of Bounce will spring up on the first turn, disappearing from view and becoming invulnerable to most attacks. On the second turn, Bounce deals damage and has a 30% chance of paralyzing the target. While in the air, the Pokémon can only be hit by the moves Gust, Twister, Thunder, Sky Uppercut and Smack Down, with Gust and Twister dealing twice normal damage. Moves from No Guard Pokémon, or any move following an identify move can also hit for regular power. Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed. If the user is holding a Power Herb, Bounce executes in one turn.

name: Bouncy Bubble
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Bouncy Bubble deals damage and heals the user for half the damage dealt to the opponent. Bouncy Bubble is an Eevee-exclusive tutor move from Pokémon Let's Go, along with Buzzy Buzz, Sizzly Slide, Glitzy Glow, Baddy Bad, Sappy Seed, Freezy Frost, and Sparkly Swirl.

name: Branch Poke
description: The user attacks the target by poking it with a sharply pointed branch.
effect: Branch Poke has no added effects.

name: Brave Bird
description: The user tucks in its wings and charges from a low altitude. This also damages the user quite a lot.
effect: Brave Bird deals damage, but the user receives 1⁄3 of the damage it inflicted in recoil. In other words, if the attack does 90 HP damage to the opponent, the user will lose 30 HP.

name: Breaking Swipe
description: The user swings its tough tail wildly and attacks opposing Pokémon. This also lowers their Attack stats.
effect: Hits multiple opponents and lowers their attack.

name: Breakneck Blitz
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Breakneck Blitz is the Normal type Z-Move, introduced in Pokémon Sun/Moon.

name: Brick Break
description: The user attacks with a swift chop. It can also break barriers, such as Light Screen and Reflect.
effect: Brick Break deals damage, but removes the effects of Reflect and Light Screen before attacking.

name: Brine
description: If the target’s HP is half or less, this attack will hit with double the power.
effect: Power doubles if opponent's HP is less than 50%.

name: Brutal Swing
description: The user swings its body around violently to inflict damage on everything in its vicinity.
effect: The user swings its body around violently to inflict damage on everything in its vicinity.

name: Bubble
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Bubble deals damage and has a 10% chance of lowering the target's Speed by one stage.

name: Bubble Beam
description: A spray of bubbles is forcefully ejected at the target. This may also lower the target’s Speed stat.
effect: Bubble Beam deals damage and has a 10% chance of lowering the target's Speed by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Bug Bite
description: The user bites the target. If the target is holding a Berry, the user eats it and gains its effect.
effect: Bug Bite deals damage, and if the target is holding a Berry, the user eats it and gains its effect. For example, if the target is holding a Sitrus Berry the user will recover 1⁄4 of the its HP. Bug Bite cannot steal a berry from a Substitute.

name: Bug Buzz
description: The user generates a damaging sound wave by vibration. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.
effect: Bug Buzz deals damage and has a 10% chance of lowering the target's Special Defense by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Bulk Up
description: The user tenses its muscles to bulk up its body, raising both its Attack and Defense stats.
effect: Bulk Up raises the user's Attack and Defense by one stage each. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Bulldoze
description: The user strikes everything around it by stomping down on the ground. This lowers the Speed stats of those hit.
effect: Bulldoze deals damage and lowers the target's Speed by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Bullet Punch
description: The user strikes the target with tough punches as fast as bullets. This move always goes first.
effect: Bullet Punch deals damage and has a priority of +1. Moves with a higher priority always go first, regardless of a Pokémon's speed. If two moves with the same priority are used, the faster Pokémon goes first as usual.

name: Bullet Seed
description: The user forcefully shoots seeds at the target two to five times in a row.

name: Burn Up
description: To inflict massive damage, the user burns itself out. After using this move, the user will no longer be Fire type.
effect: To inflict massive damage, the user burns itself out. After using this move, the user will no longer be Fire type.

name: Buzzy Buzz
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Buzzy Buzz deals damage and paralyzes the target. Buzzy Buzz is an Eevee-exclusive tutor move from Pokémon Let's Go, along with Bouncy Bubble, Sizzly Slide, Glitzy Glow, Baddy Bad, Sappy Seed, Freezy Frost, and Sparkly Swirl.

name: Calm Mind
description: The user quietly focuses its mind and calms its spirit to raise its Sp. Atk and Sp. Def stats.
effect: Calm Mind raises the user's Special Attack and Special Defense by one stage each. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Camouflage
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Camouflage causes the user to change its type based on the current terrain:

name: Captivate
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Captivate lowers the Special Attack of the target by two stages, if they are of the opposite gender to the user. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. Captivate will fail if both Pokémon are the same gender, either Pokémon is genderless, or the target has the ability Oblivious.

name: Catastropika
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Catastropika is a Z-Move exclusive to Pikachu. It can only be used with Volt Tackle.

name: Celebrate
description: The Pokémon congratulates you on your special day!
effect: The Pokémon congratulates you on your special day. No battle effect.

name: Charge
description: The user boosts the power of the Electric move it uses on the next turn. This also raises the user’s Sp. Def stat.
effect: Charge raises the user's Special Defense by one stage, and if this Pokémon's next move is a damage-dealing Electric-type attack, it will deal double damage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Charge Beam
description: The user attacks the target with an electric charge. The user may use any remaining electricity to raise its Sp. Atk stat.
effect: Charge Beam deals damage and has a 70% chance of raising the user's Special Attack by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Charm
description: The user gazes at the target rather charmingly, making it less wary. This harshly lowers the target’s Attack stat.
effect: Charm lowers the target's Attack by two stages. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Chatter
description: The user attacks the target with sound waves of deafening chatter. This confuses the target.
effect: Chatter deals damage and causes the target to become confused. Confused Pokémon have a 33% chance of hurting themselves each turn, for 1-4 attacking turns (50% chance in Generations 1-6). The damage received is as if the Pokémon attacks itself with a typeless 40 base power Physical attack. Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused.

name: Chip Away
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Chip Away deals damage, but ignores changes to the target's stats (i.e. Defense and Evasion in this case). Note this does not include the effects of screens like Reflect as they are different to regular stat boosts.

name: Circle Throw
description: The target is thrown, and a different Pokémon is dragged out. In the wild, this ends a battle against a single Pokémon.
effect: In battles, the opponent switches. In the wild, the Pokémon runs.

name: Clamp
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Clamp inflicts damage on the first turn then traps the opponent, causing them to lose 1⁄8 of their maximum HP after each turn, for 4-5 turns. If the user holds a Grip Claw, the after-effects last for 7 turns. If a Binding Band is held, the damage is 1⁄6 of the target's maximum HP.

name: Clanging Scales
description: The user rubs the scales on its entire body and makes a huge noise to attack opposing Pokémon. The user’s Defense stat goes down after the attack.
effect: Clanging Scales deals damage but lowers the user's Defense by one stage after attacking. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Clangorous Soul
description: The user raises all its stats by using some of its HP.
effect: Raises all user's stats but loses HP.

name: Clangorous Soulblaze
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Clangorous Soulblaze is a Dragon type Z-Move exclusive to Kommo-o, introduced in Pokémon Ultra Sun & Ultra Moon. It is used with Clanging Scales. Clangorous Soulblaze deals damage and raises all of the user's stats - Attack, Defense, Special Attack, Special Defense and Speed - by one level each. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Clear Smog
description: The user attacks the target by throwing a clump of special mud. All stat changes are returned to normal.
effect: Removes all of the target's stat changes.

name: Close Combat
description: The user fights the target up close without guarding itself. This also lowers the user’s Defense and Sp. Def stats.
effect: Close Combat deals damage but lowers the user's Defense and Special Defense by one stage each after attacking. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Coil
description: The user coils up and concentrates. This raises its Attack and Defense stats as well as its accuracy.
effect: Coil raises the user's Attack, Defense and Accuracy by one stage each. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Comet Punch
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.

name: Confide
description: The user tells the target a secret, and the target loses its ability to concentrate. This lowers the target’s Sp. Atk stat.
effect: Confide lowers the target's Special Attack by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Confuse Ray
description: The target is exposed to a sinister ray that triggers confusion.
effect: Confuse Ray causes the target to become confused. Confused Pokémon have a 33% chance of hurting themselves each turn, for 1-4 attacking turns (50% chance in Generations 1-6). The damage received is as if the Pokémon attacks itself with a typeless 40 base power Physical attack. Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused.

name: Confusion
description: The target is hit by a weak telekinetic force. This may also confuse the target.
effect: Confusion deals damage and has a 10% chance of confusing the target. Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused.

name: Constrict
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Constrict deals damage and has a 10% chance of lowering the target's Speed by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Continental Crush
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Continental Crush is the Rock type Z-Move, introduced in Pokémon Sun/Moon.

name: Conversion
description: The user changes its type to become the same type as the move at the top of the list of moves it knows.
effect: Conversion changes the user's type to the same type as the first move in the Pokémon's move list. For example, if the Pokémon has the moves Psybeam, Discharge, Recover and Conversion in that order, Conversion will change the user's type to Psychic.

name: Conversion 2
description: The user changes its type to make itself resistant to the type of the attack the target used last.
effect: Conversion 2 changes the user's type to one that is resistant (or immune) to the last move used by the target, randomly. For example, if the target last used a Fighting type move, Conversion 2 would change the user's type to one of Poison, Flying, Psychic, Bug, Ghost or Fairy at random.

name: Copycat
description: The user mimics the move used immediately before it. The move fails if no other move has been used yet.
effect: Copies opponent's last move.

name: Core Enforcer
description: If the Pokémon the user has inflicted damage on have already used their moves, this move eliminates the effect of the target’s Ability.
effect: Scorches a 'Z' pattern on the ground.

name: Corkscrew Crash
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Corkscrew Crash is the Steel type Z-Move, introduced in Pokémon Sun/Moon.

name: Cosmic Power
description: The user absorbs a mystical power from space to raise its Defense and Sp. Def stats.
effect: Cosmic Power raises the user's Defense and Special Defense by one stage each. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Cotton Guard
description: The user protects itself by wrapping its body in soft cotton, which drastically raises the user’s Defense stat.
effect: Cotton Guard raises the user's Defense by three stages. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. Assuming no other stat changes, the first use of Cotton Guard would raise Defense to 2.5× normal value, and the second to 4× (the maximum level).

name: Cotton Spore
description: The user releases cotton-like spores that cling to opposing Pokémon, which harshly lowers their Speed stats.
effect: Cotton Spore lowers the target's Speed by two stages. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Counter
description: A retaliation move that counters any physical attack, inflicting double the damage taken.
effect: When hit by a Physical Attack, user strikes back with 2x power.

name: Court Change
description: With its mysterious power, the user swaps the effects on either side of the field.
effect: Swaps the effects on either side of the field.

name: Covet
description: The user endearingly approaches the target, then steals the target’s held item.
effect: Covet deals damage and steals the target's held item, if the user is not already holding an item. Items stolen from wild Pokémon are kept after the battle ends, but items stolen from a Trainer's Pokémon are not. Items stolen from the player's Pokémon, either by wild Pokémon or Trainer Pokémon, are returned at the end of the battle. All held items in wi-fi/linked battles (including Battle Tower/Subway/Maison) are returned to their respective owners at the end of a battle. If the item would activate on attack (e.g. Focus Band), it does so before being stolen. If the item is consumable on attack (e.g. Focus Sash) then the item is consumed as normal and cannot be stolen. Pokemon with the ability Sticky Hold cannot have their held item removed. The Griseous Orb cannot be removed from Giratina; Type Plates cannot be removed from Arceus; Drives cannot be removed from Genesect; and Mega Stones cannot be removed from their respective Pokémon.

name: Crabhammer
description: The target is hammered with a large pincer. Critical hits land more easily.
effect: Crabhammer deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio (1⁄8 instead of 1⁄16).

name: Crafty Shield
description: The user protects itself and its allies from status moves with a mysterious power. This does not stop moves that do damage.
effect: Crafty Shield protects the user's team from any Status category move targeted at them, for the duration of the turn. It has priority +3 so will activate before most other moves. It does not protect against the moves Perish Song, Spikes, Stealth Rock, Toxic Spikes, or Sticky Web; and it does not prevent moves that target the attacker itself (such as Rest).

name: Cross Chop
description: The user delivers a double chop with its forearms crossed. Critical hits land more easily.
effect: Cross Chop deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio (1⁄8 instead of 1⁄16).

name: Cross Poison
description: A slashing attack with a poisonous blade that may also poison the target. Critical hits land more easily.
effect: Cross Poison deals damage and has a 10% chance of poisoning the target. It also has an increased critical hit ratio (1⁄8 instead of 1⁄16). Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned.

name: Crunch
description: The user crunches up the target with sharp fangs. This may also lower the target’s Defense stat.
effect: Crunch deals damage and has a 20% chance of lowering the target's Defense by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Crush Claw
description: The user slashes the target with hard and sharp claws. This may also lower the target’s Defense stat.
effect: Crush Claw deals damage and has a 50% chance of lowering the target's Defense by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Crush Grip
description: The target is crushed with great force. The more HP the target has left, the greater this move’s power.
effect: Crush Grip inflicts more damage when the opponent's HP is higher. At full HP its base power is 120 and it decreases in proportion - i.e. the power is:

name: Curse
description: A move that works differently for the Ghost type than for all other types.
effect: Curse is a unique move that works differently for Ghost-type Pokémon than other Pokémon. Ghost-type Pokémon use 50% of their maximum HP to place a curse on the target. The cursed Pokémon loses 25% of their maximum HP every turn. If the user has less than 50% HP remaining, they will faint but the curse still takes effect. For all other Pokémon, Curse raises the user's Attack and Defense by one stage each and lowers Speed by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each, or lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Cut
description: The target is cut with a scythe or claw.
effect: Cut deals damage with no additional effect in battle.

name: Dark Pulse
description: The user releases a horrible aura imbued with dark thoughts. This may also make the target flinch.
effect: Dark Pulse deals damage and has a 20% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved). Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.

name: Dark Void
description: Opposing Pokémon are dragged into a world of total darkness that makes them sleep.
effect: Dark Void puts the target(s) to sleep. It can only be used by Darkrai. It targets all adjacent opponents i.e. the opposing Pokémon in a single battle, both opponents in a double battle, three opponents if in the center of a triple battle, or two opponents if situated at the side in a triple battle. Each target is counted as a separate attack so it may succeed for all, any or none of the targets. Sleeping Pokémon cannot move (with some exceptions such as Snore). Sleep lasts for 1-3 turns. Pokémon with the abilities Insomnia or Vital Spirit, or those behind a Substitute cannot be put to sleep.

name: Darkest Lariat
description: The user swings both arms and hits the target. The target’s stat changes don’t affect this attack’s damage.
effect: Darkest Lariat deals damage, but ignores changes to the target's stats (i.e. Defense and Evasion in this case).

name: Dazzling Gleam
description: The user damages opposing Pokémon by emitting a powerful flash.
effect: Dazzling Gleam deals damage and hits all adjacent opponents in double/triple battles.

name: Decorate
description: The user sharply raises the target’s Attack and Sp. Atk stats by decorating the target.
effect: Sharply raises target's Attack and Special Attack.

name: Defend Order
description: The user calls out its underlings to shield its body, raising its Defense and Sp. Def stats.
effect: Defend Order raises the user's Defense and Special Defense by one stage each. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Defense Curl
description: The user curls up to conceal weak spots and raise its Defense stat.
effect: Defense Curl raises the user's Defense by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. After Defense Curl has been used at least once and while the user stays in battle, the power of Rollout and Ice Ball is double their regular base power.

name: Defog
description: A strong wind blows away the target’s barriers such as Reflect or Light Screen. This also lowers the target’s evasiveness.
effect: Defog lowers the target's Evasion by one stage and removes entry hazards and barriers on both sides of the field. The moves affected are: Light Screen, Reflect, Mist, Safeguard, Spikes, Stealth Rock, Sticky Web and Toxic Spikes. Defog also clears foggy weather in battle (which causes Accuracy loss when present), however this weather condition is only present in Sinnoh (Diamond/Pearl/Platinum) and cannot be created in battle otherwise.

name: Destiny Bond
description: After using this move, if the user faints, the Pokémon that landed the knockout hit also faints. Its chance of failing rises if it is used in succession.
effect: If the user faints, the opponent also faints.

name: Detect
description: This move enables the user to protect itself from all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used in succession.
effect: Detect prevents any attacks targeted at the user from striking, for the duration of the turn. It has priority +4 so will activate before most other moves. The move functions identically to Protect. The accuracy of Detect drops by 1⁄3 each time it is used consecutively after itself or Protect, Endure, Wide Guard, Quick Guard, Spiky Shield, King's Shield, or Baneful Bunker. Damage-dealing Z-Moves bypass Detect but deal 1⁄4 of the damage.

name: Devastating Drake
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Devastating Drake is the Dragon type Z-Move, introduced in Pokémon Sun/Moon.

name: Diamond Storm
description: The user whips up a storm of diamonds to damage opposing Pokémon. This may also sharply raise the user’s Defense stat.
effect: Diamond Storm deals damage and has a 50% chance of raising the user's Defense by two stages. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Dig
description: The user burrows into the ground, then attacks on the next turn.
effect: The user of Dig will burrow its way underground on the first turn, disappearing from view and becoming invulnerable to most attacks. On the second turn, Dig deals damage. While underground, the Pokémon can only be hit by the moves Earthquake, Magnitude or Fissure, with Earthquake and Magnitude dealing twice normal damage. Moves from No Guard Pokémon, or any move following an identify move can also hit for regular power. The user also avoids end-of-turn damage from Sandstorm and Hail when underground. If the user is holding a Power Herb, Dig executes in one turn.

name: Disable
description: For four turns, this move prevents the target from using the move it last used.
effect: Disable causes the previous move the target used to be disabled for 1-8 turns, which prevents the move's use.

name: Disarming Voice
description: Letting out a charming cry, the user does emotional damage to opposing Pokémon. This attack never misses.
effect: Disarming Voice deals damage and ignores changes to the Accuracy and Evasion stats. However, it will not hit Pokémon during the invulnerable stage of Bounce, Dig, Dive, Fly, Shadow Force or Sky Drop.

name: Discharge
description: The user strikes everything around it by letting loose a flare of electricity. This may also cause paralysis.
effect: Discharge deals damage and has a 30% chance of paralyzing the target(s). Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.

name: Dive
description: Diving on the first turn, the user floats up and attacks on the next turn.
effect: The user of Dive will hide underwater on the first turn, disappearing from view and becoming invulnerable to most attacks. On the second turn, Dive deals damage. While underwater, the Pokémon can only be hit by the moves Surf, Whirlpool or Low Kick, with Surf and Whirlpool dealing twice normal damage. Moves from No Guard Pokémon, or any move following an identify move can also hit for regular power. The user also avoids end-of-turn damage from Sandstorm and Hail when underwater. If the user is holding a Power Herb, Dive executes in one turn.

name: Dizzy Punch
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Dizzy Punch deals damage and has a 20% chance of confusing the target. Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused.

name: Doom Desire
description: Two turns after this move is used, a concentrated bundle of light blasts the target.
effect: Two turns after the move is selected, Doom Desire will deal damage. If the opponent switched Pokémon in the meantime, the damage dealt will depend on the Special Defense of the Pokémon the move hits, not the Pokémon it was originally targeted at.

name: Double Hit
description: The user slams the target with a long tail, vines, or a tentacle. The target is hit twice in a row.
effect: Double Hit deals damage and will strike twice (with 35 base power each time). Each strike of Double Hit is treated like a separate attack:

name: Double Iron Bash
description: The user rotates, centering the hex nut in its chest, and then strikes with its arms twice in a row. This may also make the target flinch.
effect: Double Iron Bash deals damage, will strike twice (with 60 base power each time), and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved). Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.

name: Double Kick
description: The target is quickly kicked twice in succession using both feet.
effect:
Double Kick deals damage and will strike twice (with 30 base power each time).
Each strike of Double Kick is treated like a separate attack:

name: Double Slap
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.

name: Double Team
description: By moving rapidly, the user makes illusory copies of itself to raise its evasiveness.
effect: Double Team raises the user's Evasiveness by one stage, thus making the user more difficult to hit. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Double-Edge
description: A reckless, life-risking tackle in which the user rushes the target. This also damages the user quite a lot.
effect: Double-Edge deals damage, but the user receives 1⁄3 of the damage it inflicted in recoil. In other words, if the attack does 90 HP damage to the opponent, the user will lose 30 HP.

name: Draco Meteor
description: Comets are summoned down from the sky onto the target. The attack’s recoil harshly lowers the user’s Sp. Atk stat.
effect: Draco Meteor deals damage but lowers the user's Special Attack by two stages after attacking. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Dragon Ascent
description: After soaring upward, the user attacks its target by dropping out of the sky at high speeds. But it lowers its own Defense and Sp. Def stats in the process.
effect: Dragon Ascent deals damage but lowers the user's Defense and Special Defense by one stage each after attacking. It is the signature move of Rayquaza, and once learned allows Rayquaza to Mega-Evolve.

name: Dragon Breath
description: The user exhales a mighty gust that inflicts damage. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
effect: Dragon Breath deals damage and has a 30% chance of paralyzing the target. Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.

name: Dragon Claw
description: The user slashes the target with huge sharp claws.
effect: Dragon Claw deals damage with no additional effect.

name: Dragon Dance
description: The user vigorously performs a mystic, powerful dance that raises its Attack and Speed stats.
effect: Dragon Dance raises the user's Attack and Speed by one stage each. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Dragon Darts
description: The user attacks twice using Dreepy. If there are two targets, this move hits each target once.
effect: Dragon Darts deals damage and hits twice. In a double battle, it hits each opponent once. Dragon Darts is the signature more of Dragapult.

name: Dragon Hammer
description: The user uses its body like a hammer to attack the target and inflict damage.
effect: The user uses its body like a hammer to attack the target and inflict damage.

name: Dragon Pulse
description: The target is attacked with a shock wave generated by the user’s gaping mouth.
effect: Dragon Pulse deals damage with no additional effect.

name: Dragon Rage
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Dragon Rage always deals 40 HP damage to the target, regardless of typing. It has no additional effect.

name: Dragon Rush
description: The user tackles the target while exhibiting overwhelming menace. This may also make the target flinch.
effect: Dragon Rush deals damage and has a 20% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved). Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch. If the target has used Minimize, Dragon Rush ignores accuracy and deals double damage.

name: Dragon Tail
description: The target is knocked away, and a different Pokémon is dragged out. In the wild, this ends a battle against a single Pokémon.
effect: In battles, the opponent switches. In the wild, the Pokémon runs.

name: Drain Punch
description: An energy-draining punch. The user’s HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.
effect: Drain Punch deals damage and the user will recover 50% of the HP drained. If the user is holding a Big Root, the move instead recovers 65% of the damage dealt (30% more than normal). If used on a Pokémon with the ability Liquid Ooze, the user instead loses the HP it would have otherwise gained.

name: Draining Kiss
description: The user steals the target’s HP with a kiss. The user’s HP is restored by over half of the damage taken by the target.
effect: Draining Kiss deals damage and the user will recover 75% of the HP drained.

name: Dream Eater
description: The user eats the dreams of a sleeping target. The user’s HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.
effect: Dream Eater deals damage only on sleeping foes and the user will recover 50% of the HP drained.  If the user is holding a Big Root, the move instead recovers 65% of the damage dealt (30% more than normal). If used on a Pokémon with the ability Liquid Ooze, the user instead loses the HP it would have otherwise gained.

name: Drill Peck
description: A corkscrewing attack that strikes the target with a sharp beak acting as a drill.
effect: Drill Peck deals damage with no additional effect, besides being able to hit non-adjacent Pokémon in triple battles.

name: Drill Run
description: The user crashes into its target while rotating its body like a drill. Critical hits land more easily.
effect: Drill Run deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio (1⁄8 instead of 1⁄16).

name: Drum Beating
description: The user plays its drum, controlling the drum’s roots to attack the target. This also lowers the target’s Speed stat.
effect: Lowers opponent's Speed.

name: Dual Chop
description: The user attacks its target by hitting it with brutal strikes. The target is hit twice in a row.
effect:
Dual Chop deals damage and will strike twice (with 40 base power each time).
Each strike of Dual Chop is treated like a separate attack:

name: Dynamax Cannon
description: The user unleashes a strong beam from its core. This move deals twice the damage if the target is Dynamaxed.
effect: Damage doubles if user is Dynamaxed.

name: Dynamic Punch
description: The user punches the target with full, concentrated power. This confuses the target if it hits.
effect: Dynamic Punch deals damage and confuses the target, if it hits. Confused Pokémon have a 33% chance of hurting themselves each turn, for 1-4 attacking turns (50% chance in Generations 1-6). The damage received is as if the Pokémon attacks itself with a typeless 40 base power Physical attack. Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused.

name: Earth Power
description: The user makes the ground under the target erupt with power. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.
effect: Earth Power deals damage and has a 10% chance of lowering the target's Special Defense by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Earthquake
description: The user sets off an earthquake that strikes every Pokémon around it.
effect: Earthquake deals damage, and will hit with double power if the opponent is underground due to the move Dig.

name: Echoed Voice
description: The user attacks the target with an echoing voice. If this move is used every turn, its power is increased.
effect: Echoed Voice deals damage starting at base power 40, and increases by 40 each turn if used by any Pokémon on the field, up to a maximum base power of 200. It does not reset if it misses, as long as the move is attempted each turn. The power does not increase during a turn (if multiple Pokémon use it), only after each turn.

name: Eerie Impulse
description: The user’s body generates an eerie impulse. Exposing the target to it harshly lowers the target’s Sp. Atk stat.
effect: Eerie Impulse lowers the target's Special Attack by two stages. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Egg Bomb
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Egg Bomb deals damage with no additional effect.

name: Electric Terrain
description: The user electrifies the ground for five turns, powering up Electric-type moves. Pokémon on the ground no longer fall asleep.
effect: Electric Terrain creates a low-lying electric field lasting 5 turns, that prevents grounded Pokémon from falling asleep. The power of Electric type moves also increases by 50% while in effect. Grounded Pokémon are simply those that are not raised. Raised Pokémon are any Flying types or those under the effects of Levitate, Magnet Rise or Telekinesis. Full details in glossary. Electric Terrain is a terrain condition and can coexist at the same time as weather conditions, but not other terrain conditions. The move Nature Power turns into Thunderbolt under Electric Terrain.

name: Electrify
description: If the target is electrified before it uses a move during that turn, the target’s move becomes Electric type.
effect: Electrify causes the target's move to become Electric type, if it has yet to attack during that turn.

name: Electro Ball
description: The user hurls an electric orb at the target. The faster the user is than the target, the greater the move’s power.

name: Electroweb
description: The user attacks and captures opposing Pokémon using an electric net. This lowers their Speed stats.
effect: Electroweb deals damage and lowers the target's Speed by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Embargo
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Embargo prevents the target using any items for five turns. This includes both held items and items used by the trainer such as medicines.

name: Ember
description: The target is attacked with small flames. This may also leave the target with a burn.
effect: Ember deals damage and has a 10% chance of burning the target. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned.

name: Encore
description: The user compels the target to keep using the move it encored for three turns.
effect: Encore forces the target to use the previously selected move for 3 turns. Encore does not work against Encore itself, Mimic, Mirror Move, Sketch, Struggle or Transform.

name: Endeavor
description: This attack move cuts down the target’s HP to equal the user’s HP.
effect: Endeavor reduces the opponent's HP to equal the user's. (It fails if the user's HP is higher than the target's.)

name: Endure
description: The user endures any attack with at least 1 HP. Its chance of failing rises if it is used in succession.
effect: Endure allows the user to survive all attacks during the turn with at least 1 HP (even if it already has 1 HP remaining). It has priority +4 so will activate before most other moves. The accuracy of Endure decreases by 1⁄3 each time it is used consecutively after itself or Protect, Detect, Wide Guard, Quick Guard, Spiky Shield, King's Shield, or Baneful Bunker.

name: Energy Ball
description: The user draws power from nature and fires it at the target. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.
effect: Energy Ball deals damage and has a 10% chance of lowering the target's Special Defense by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Entrainment
description: The user dances with an odd rhythm that compels the target to mimic it, making the target’s Ability the same as the user’s.
effect: Entrainment makes the target's ability the same as the user's. It does not work on Pokémon with the abilities Truant, Multitype or Zen Mode.

name: Eruption
description: The user attacks opposing Pokémon with explosive fury. The lower the user’s HP, the lower the move’s power.
effect: Eruption inflicts more damage when the user's HP is higher. At full HP its base power is 150 and it decreases in proportion - i.e. the power is:

name: Eternabeam
description: This is Eternatus’s most powerful attack in its original form. The user can’t move on the next turn.
effect: User can't move on the next turn.

name: Explosion
description: The user attacks everything around it by causing a tremendous explosion. The user faints upon using this move.
effect: Explosion deals high damage, but causes the user to faint.

name: Extrasensory
description: The user attacks with an odd, unseeable power. This may also make the target flinch.
effect: Extrasensory deals damage and has a 10% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved). Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.

name: Extreme Evoboost
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Extreme Evoboost is a Z-Move exclusive to Eevee. It is used with Last Resort. Extreme Evoboost raises all the user's stats (Attack, Defense, Special Attack, Special Defense, Speed) by two stages each.

name: Extreme Speed
description: The user charges the target at blinding speed. This move always goes first.
effect: Extreme Speed deals damage and attacks before the majority of other moves (priority of +2).

name: Facade
description: This attack move doubles its power if the user is poisoned, burned, or paralyzed.
effect: Facade deals damage, and hits with double power (140) if the user is burned, poisoned or paralyzed. In the case of a burn, the usual attack-halving still occurs so Facade hits with an effective power of 70.

name: Fairy Lock
description: By locking down the battlefield, the user keeps all Pokémon from fleeing during the next turn.
effect: Fairy Lock prevents all Pokémon on the field from fleeing during the following turn.

name: Fairy Wind
description: The user stirs up a fairy wind and strikes the target with it.
effect: Fairy Wind deals damage with no added effects.

name: Fake Out
description: This attack hits first and makes the target flinch. It only works the first turn each time the user enters battle.
effect: Fake Out attacks with a priority of +3 and causes the target to flinch if it hits. It is only successful on the first turn the Pokémon is in battle, but reset each time the Pokémon switches out and back in. Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.

name: Fake Tears
description: The user feigns crying to fluster the target, harshly lowering its Sp. Def stat.
effect: Fake Tears lowers the target's Special Defense by two stages. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: False Surrender
description: The user pretends to bow its head, but then it stabs the target with its disheveled hair. This attack never misses.
effect: Ignores Accuracy and Evasiveness.

name: False Swipe
description: A restrained attack that prevents the target from fainting. The target is left with at least 1 HP.
effect: Always leaves opponent with at least 1 HP.

name: Feather Dance
description: The user covers the target’s body with a mass of down that harshly lowers its Attack stat.
effect: Feather Dance lowers the target's Attack by two stages. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Feint
description: This attack hits a target using a move such as Protect or Detect. This also lifts the effects of those moves.
effect: Feint only hits if the target used Protect or Detect in the same turn. It also cancels Protect/Detect for the remainder of the turn, so subsequent moves in the same turn (in double/triple battles) can still hit.

name: Feint Attack
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Feint Attack deals damage and ignores changes to the Accuracy and Evasion stats. However, it will not hit Pokémon during the invulnerable stage of Bounce, Dig, Dive, Fly, Shadow Force or Sky Drop.

name: Fell Stinger
description: When the user knocks out a target with this move, the user’s Attack stat rises drastically.
effect: Fell Stinger deals damage, and if the target is knocked out by this move, the user's Attack is raised by three stages. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Fiery Dance
description: Cloaked in flames, the user attacks the target by dancing and flapping its wings. This may also raise the user’s Sp. Atk stat.
effect: Fiery Dance deals damage and has a 50% chance of raising the user's Special Attack by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Final Gambit
description: The user risks everything to attack its target. The user faints but does damage equal to its HP.
effect: Inflicts damage equal to the user's remaining HP. User faints.

name: Fire Blast
description: The target is attacked with an intense blast of all-consuming fire. This may also leave the target with a burn.
effect: Fire Blast deals damage and has a 10% chance of burning the target. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned.

name: Fire Fang
description: The user bites with flame-cloaked fangs. This may also make the target flinch or leave it with a burn.
effect: Fire Fang deals damage, has a 10% chance of burning the target and has a 10% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved). Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned. Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.

name: Fire Lash
description: The user strikes the target with a burning lash. This also lowers the target’s Defense stat.
effect: The user strikes the target with a burning lash. This also lowers the target's Defense stat.

name: Fire Pledge
description: A column of fire hits the target. When used with its grass equivalent, its power increases and a vast sea of fire appears.
effect: Fire Pledge deals damage at base power 80. If a teammate uses Grass Pledge or Water Pledge in the same turn, the moves combine into one attack of base power 160 and added effects appear. The faster Pokémon moves first but waits for the other Pokémon to make their move. When the slower Pledge user moves, the combo attack hits the Pokémon the slower user was targeting. If Fire Pledge is used with Grass Pledge, the move animation shows Fire Pledge and a sea of fire envelops the foe's team is created that damages opponents 1⁄8 of their maximum HP each turn, for 4 turns. If Fire Pledge is used with Water Pledge, the move animation shows Water Pledge and a rainbow appears in the sky on your team's side that doubles the chance of moves' secondary effects occurring for 4 turns.

name: Fire Punch
description: The target is punched with a fiery fist. This may also leave the target with a burn.
effect: Fire Punch deals damage and has a 10% chance of burning the target. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned.

name: Fire Spin
description: The target becomes trapped within a fierce vortex of fire that rages for four to five turns.
effect: Fire Spin inflicts damage on the first turn then traps the opponent, causing them to lose 1⁄8 of their maximum HP after each turn, for 4-5 turns. If the user holds a Grip Claw, the after-effects last for 7 turns. If a Binding Band is held, the damage is 1⁄6 of the target's maximum HP.

name: First Impression
description: Although this move has great power, it only works the first turn each time the user enters battle.
effect: Although this move has great power, it only works the first turn the user is in battle.

name: Fishious Rend
description: The user rends the target with its hard gills. If the user attacks before the target, the power of this move is doubled.
effect: If the user attacks before the target, the power of this move is doubled.

name: Fissure
description: The user opens up a fissure in the ground and drops the target in. The target faints instantly if this attack hits.
effect: If it hits, Fissure is guaranteed to make the opponent faint. It is more likely to hit Pokémon that are of a lower level than the user. Its accuracy (as a percentage) is calculated as below, ignoring all other accuracy and evasion modifiers:

name: Flail
description: The user flails about aimlessly to attack. The less HP the user has, the greater the move’s power.
effect: Flail deals more damage the lower the user's HP. The following formula is used:

name: Flame Burst
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Flame Burst deals damage and will also cause splash damage to any Pokémon adjacent to the target (including the user if Flame Burst is targeted at an ally). The splash damage caused to a Pokémon is 1⁄16 of its maximum HP. It is typeless and not counted as regular damage but treated similarly to weather damage, which means that:

name: Flame Charge
description: Cloaking itself in flame, the user attacks the target. Then, building up more power, the user raises its Speed stat.
effect: Flame Charge deals damage and raises the user's Speed by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Flame Wheel
description: The user cloaks itself in fire and charges at the target. This may also leave the target with a burn.
effect: Flame Wheel deals damage and has a 10% chance of burning the target. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned. If the user is frozen, Flame Wheel can be used and will thaw out the Pokémon before attacking.

name: Flamethrower
description: The target is scorched with an intense blast of fire. This may also leave the target with a burn.
effect: Flamethrower deals damage and has a 10% chance of burning the target. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned.

name: Flare Blitz
description: The user cloaks itself in fire and charges the target. This also damages the user quite a lot. This attack may leave the target with a burn.
effect: Flare Blitz deals damage and has a 10% chance of burning the target, but the user receives 1⁄3 of the damage it inflicted in recoil. In other words, if the attack does 90 HP damage to the opponent, the user will lose 30 HP. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned. If the user is frozen, Flare Blitz can be used and will thaw out the Pokémon before attacking.

name: Flash
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Flash lowers the target's Accuracy by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. Pokémon with the abilities Keen Eye, Clear Body or White Smoke cannot have their accuracy reduced.

name: Flash Cannon
description: The user gathers all its light energy and releases it all at once. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.
effect: Flash Cannon deals damage and has a 10% chance of lowering the target's Special Defense by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Flatter
description: Flattery is used to confuse the target. However, this also raises the target’s Sp. Atk stat.
effect: Confuses opponent, but raises its Special Attack by two stages.

name: Fleur Cannon
description: The user unleashes a strong beam. The attack’s recoil harshly lowers the user’s Sp. Atk stat.
effect: Fleur Cannon deals damage but lowers the user's Special Attack by two stages after attacking. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Fling
description: The user flings its held item at the target to attack. This move’s power and effects depend on the item.
effect: Power depends on held item.

name: Floaty Fall
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Floaty Fall deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved). Floaty Fall is a Pikachu-exclusive tutor move from Pokémon Let's Go, along with Zippy Zap and Splishy Splash.

name: Floral Healing
description: The user restores the target’s HP by up to half of its max HP. It restores more HP when the terrain is grass.
effect: The user restores the target's HP by up to half of its max HP. It restores more HP when the terrain is grass.

name: Flower Shield
description: The user raises the Defense stats of all Grass-type Pokémon in battle with a mysterious power.
effect: Flower Shield raises the Defense of all Grass-type Pokémon in battle (including opponents) by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Fly
description: The user flies up into the sky and then strikes its target on the next turn.
effect: The user of Fly will fly up high on the first turn, disappearing from view and becoming invulnerable to most attacks. On the second turn, Fly deals damage. While in the air, the Pokémon can only be hit by the moves Gust, Twister, Thunder, Sky Uppercut and Smack Down, with Gust and Twister dealing twice normal damage. Moves from No Guard Pokémon, or any move following an identify move can also hit for regular power. If the user is holding a Power Herb, Fly executes in one turn.

name: Flying Press
description: The user dives down onto the target from the sky. This move is Fighting and Flying type simultaneously.
effect: Flying Press deals damage. It is a Fighting type move, but deals a combination of Fighting and Flying type damage. This in effect gives the move its own type chart, as shown below.

name: Focus Blast
description: The user heightens its mental focus and unleashes its power. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.
effect: Focus Blast deals damage and has a 10% chance of lowering the target's Special Defense by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Focus Energy
description: The user takes a deep breath and focuses so that critical hits land more easily.
effect: Increases critical hit ratio.

name: Focus Punch
description: The user focuses its mind before launching a punch. This move fails if the user is hit before it is used.
effect: The user of Focus Punch will tighten its focus before any other moves are made. If any regular move (with a higher priority than -3) directly hits the focused Pokémon, it loses its focus and flinches, not carrying out the attack. If no direct hits are made, Focus Punch attacks as normal. Moves of lower priority than Focus Punch - for example Avalanche or Dragon Tail - will not cause the user to lose focus. The user will tighten their focus, Focus Punch will attack, then the opponent will use their lower priority move (and in the case of Avalanche, hit with double power).

name: Follow Me
description: The user draws attention to itself, making all targets take aim only at the user.
effect: In Double Battle, the user takes all the attacks.

name: Force Palm
description: The target is attacked with a shock wave. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
effect: Force Palm deals damage and has a 30% chance of paralyzing the target. Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.

name: Foresight
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Resets opponent's Evasiveness, Normal-type and Fighting-type attacks can now hit Ghosts, and Ghost-type attacks hit Normal.

name: Forest's Curse
description: The user puts a forest curse on the target. The target is now Grass type as well.
effect: Forest's Curse adds the Grass type to the target. If the target is dual-typed they essentially become a triple-typed Pokémon. It fails if one of the Pokémon's types is already Grass. If the target is under the effect of Trick-or-Treat the Ghost type is replaced by Grass.

name: Foul Play
description: The user turns the target’s power against it. The higher the target’s Attack stat, the greater the damage it deals.
effect: Foul Play uses the opponent's Attack stat instead of the user's in damage calculation. In other words, the move acts as if the target is attacking themselves, and thus is more powerful when the opponent has higher Attack.

name: Freeze Shock
description: On the second turn, the user hits the target with electrically charged ice. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
effect: The user of Freeze Shock will charge on the first turn. On the second turn, it deals damage and has a 30% chance of paralyzing the target. Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed. If the user is holding a Power Herb, Freeze Shock executes in one turn.

name: Freeze-Dry
description: The user rapidly cools the target. This may also leave the target frozen. This move is super effective on Water types.
effect: Freeze-Dry deals damage and has a 10% change of freezing the target. In addition to Ice's usual type advantages, Freeze-Dry is also super-effective against the Water type. This in effect gives the move its own (slightly different) type chart, as shown below:

name: Freezy Frost
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Freezy Frost deals damage and eliminates stat changes from all Pokémon on the field (similar to Haze). Freezy Frost is an Eevee-exclusive tutor move from Pokémon Let's Go, along with Bouncy Bubble, Buzzy Buzz, Sizzly Slide, Glitzy Glow, Baddy Bad, Sappy Seed, and Sparkly Swirl.

name: Frenzy Plant
description: The user slams the target with the roots of an enormous tree. The user can’t move on the next turn.
effect: User must recharge next turn.

name: Frost Breath
description: The user blows its cold breath on the target. This attack always results in a critical hit.
effect: Frost Breath deals damage and always results in a critical hit, increasing its power to 90. Pokémon with the abilities Battle Armor or Shell Armor, or those under the effect of Lucky Chant are immune to critical hits so Frost Breath will hit them with base power 60.

name: Frustration
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: The power of Frustration is higher when the Pokémon likes its trainer less. The base power varies between 1 (maximum Friendship) and 102 (minimum Friendship). The exact formula is:

name: Fury Attack
description: The target is jabbed repeatedly with a horn or beak two to five times in a row.

name: Fury Cutter
description: The target is slashed with scythes or claws. This attack becomes more powerful if it hits in succession.
effect: Fury Cutter deals damage starting at base power 40, and for each successful consecutive hit doubles in power, up to a maximum base power of 160. If the move misses for any reason, the base power resets to 40.
