name: Fury Swipes
description: The target is raked with sharp claws or scythes quickly two to five times in a row.

name: Fusion Bolt
description: The user throws down a giant lightning bolt. This move’s power is increased when influenced by an enormous flame.
effect: Fusion Bolt deals damage, and its power doubles to 200 if Fusion Flare has been used before it in the same turn. If this happens Fusion Bolt's animation will change to look more epic.

name: Fusion Flare
description: The user brings down a giant flame. This move’s power is increased when influenced by an enormous lightning bolt.
effect: Fusion Flare deals damage, and its power doubles to 200 if Fusion Bolt has been used before it in the same turn. If this happens Fusion Flare's animation will change to look more epic. If the user is frozen, Fusion Flare can be used and will thaw out the Pokémon before attacking.

name: Future Sight
description: Two turns after this move is used, a hunk of psychic energy attacks the target.
effect: Future Sight deals damage, but does not hit until two turns after the move is used. If the opponent switched Pokémon in the meantime, the new Pokémon gets hit, with their type and stats taken into account. Future Sight cannot be stopped by Protect, Detect, Endure or the Wonder Guard ability.

name: G-Max Befuddle
description: A Bug-type attack that Gigantamax Butterfree use. This move inflicts the poisoned, paralyzed, or asleep status condition on opponents.
effect: G-Max Befuddle is a G-Max Move from Pokemon Sword and Shield, exclusive to Butterfree. Bug type moves turn into G-Max Befuddle during Gigantamax. G-Max Befuddle deals damage and causes poison, paralysis or sleep to each opponent.

name: G-Max Centiferno
description: A Fire-type attack that Gigantamax Centiskorch use. This move traps opponents in flames for four to five turns.
effect: G-Max Centiferno is a G-Max Move from Pokémon Sword and Shield, exclusive to Centiskorch. Fire type moves turn into G-Max Centiferno during Gigantamax. G-Max Centiferno deals damage and traps opponents, causing them to lose 1⁄8 of their maximum HP after each turn, for 4-5 turns, like the move Fire Spin.

name: G-Max Chi Strike
description: A Fighting-type attack that Gigantamax Machamp use. This move raises the chance of critical hits.
effect: G-Max Chi Strike is a G-Max Move from Pokémon Sword and Shield, exclusive to Machamp. Fighting type moves turn into G-Max Chi Strike during Gigantamax. G-Max Chi Strike deals damage and increases the user's critical hit ratio.

name: G-Max Cuddle
description: A Normal-type attack that Gigantamax Eevee use. This move infatuates opponents.
effect: G-Max Cuddle is a G-Max Move from Pokemon Sword and Shield, exclusive to Eevee. Normal type moves turn into G-Max Cuddle during Gigantamax. G-Max Cuddle deals damage and infatuates all opposite-gender opponents.

name: G-Max Depletion
description: A Dragon-type attack that Gigantamax Duraludon use. Reduces the PP of the last move used.
effect: G-Max Depletion is a G-Max Move from Pokémon Sword and Shield, exclusive to Duraludon. Dragon type moves turn into G-Max Depletion during Gigantamax. G-Max Depletion deals damage and reduces the PP of the last move used.

name: G-Max Finale
description: A Fairy-type attack that Gigantamax Alcremie use. This move heals the HP of allies.
effect: G-Max Finale is a G-Max Move from Pokemon Sword and Shield, exclusive to Alcremie. Fairy type moves turn into G-Max Finale during Gigantamax. G-Max Finale deals damage and heals Pokémon on the user's side of the field.

name: G-Max Foam Burst
description: A Water-type attack that Gigantamax Kingler use. This move harshly lowers the Speed of opponents.
effect: G-Max Foam Burst is a G-Max Move from Pokémon Sword and Shield, exclusive to Kingler. Water type moves turn into G-Max Foam Burst during Gigantamax. G-Max Foam Burst deals damage and lowers the Speed of all opponents by two stages.

name: G-Max Gold Rush
description: A Normal-type attack that Gigantamax Meowth use. This move confuses opponents and also earns extra money.
effect: G-Max Gold Rush is a G-Max Move from Pokemon Sword and Shield, exclusive to Kantonian Meowth. Normal type moves turn into G-Max Gold Rush during Gigantamax. G-Max Gold Rush deals damage and confuses all opponents. It also earns extra money after the battle.

name: G-Max Gravitas
description: A Psychic-type attack that Gigantamax Orbeetle use. This move changes gravity for five turns.
effect: G-Max Gravitas is a G-Max Move from Pokémon Sword and Shield, exclusive to Orbeetle. Psychic type moves turn into G-Max Gravitas during Gigantamax. G-Max Gravitas deals damage and summons intense gravity for 5 turns, like the move Gravity.

name: G-Max Malodor
description: A Poison-type attack that Gigantamax Garbodor use. This move poisons opponents.
effect: G-Max Malodor is a G-Max Move from Pokémon Sword and Shield, exclusive to Garbodor. Poison type moves turn into G-Max Malodor during Gigantamax. G-Max Malodor deals damage and poisons opponents.

name: G-Max Meltdown
description: A Steel-type attack that Gigantamax Melmetal use. This move makes opponents incapable of using the same move twice in a row.
effect: G-Max Meltdown is a G-Max Move from Pokémon Sword and Shield, exclusive to Melmetal. Steel type moves turn into G-Max Meltdown during Gigantamax. G-Max Meltdown deals damage and prevents opponents using the same move twice in a row, like Torment.

name: G-Max Replenish
description: A Normal-type attack that Gigantamax Snorlax use. This move restores Berries that have been eaten.
effect: G-Max Replenish is a G-Max Move from Pokémon Sword and Shield, exclusive to Snorlax. Normal type moves turn into G-Max Replenish during Gigantamax. G-Max Replenish deals damage and restores berries that have been eaten, so they can be used again.

name: G-Max Resonance
description: An Ice-type attack that Gigantamax Lapras use. This move reduces the damage received for five turns.
effect: G-Max Resonance is a G-Max Move from Pokemon Sword and Shield, exclusive to Meowth. Ice type moves turn into G-Max Resonance during Gigantamax. G-Max Resonance deals damage and reduces the damage received for 5 turns.

name: G-Max Sandblast
description: A Ground-type attack that Gigantamax Sandaconda use. Opponents are trapped in a raging sandstorm for four to five turns.
effect: G-Max Sandblast is a G-Max Move from Pokémon Sword and Shield, exclusive to Sandaconda. Ground type moves turn into G-Max Sandblast during Gigantamax. G-Max Sandblast deals damage and traps opponents, causing them to lose 1⁄8 of their maximum HP after each turn, for 4-5 turns, like the move Sand Tomb.

name: G-Max Smite
description: A Fairy-type attack that Gigantamax Hatterene use. This move confuses opponents.
effect: G-Max Smite is a G-Max Move from Pokemon Sword and Shield, exclusive to Meowth. Fairy type moves turn into G-Max Smite during Gigantamax. G-Max Smite deals damage and confuses all opponents.

name: G-Max Snooze
description: A Dark-type attack that Gigantamax Grimmsnarl use. The user lets loose a huge yawn that lulls the targets into falling asleep on the next turn.
effect: G-Max Snooze is a G-Max Move from Pokémon Sword and Shield, exclusive to Grimmsnarl. Dark type moves turn into G-Max Snooze during Gigantamax. G-Max Snooze deals damage and makes the opponents drowsy. They will fall asleep on the next turn if not switched out, like the move Yawn.

name: G-Max Steelsurge
description: A Steel-type attack that Gigantamax Copperajah use. This move scatters sharp spikes around the field.
effect: G-Max Steelsurge is a G-Max Move from Pokémon Sword and Shield, exclusive to Copperajah. Steel type moves turn into G-Max Steelsurge during Gigantamax. G-Max Steelsurge deals damage and scatters spikes around the opponents which hurts Pokémon switching in, like the move Spikes.

name: G-Max Stonesurge
description: A Water-type attack that Gigantamax Drednaw use. This move scatters sharp rocks around the field.
effect: G-Max Stonesurge is a G-Max Move from Pokemon Sword and Shield, exclusive to Drednaw. Water type moves turn into G-Max Stonesurge during Gigantamax. G-Max Stonesurge deals damage and scatters sharp rocks around the opponent, like Stealth Rock.

name: G-Max Stun Shock
description: An Electric-type attack that Gigantamax Toxtricity use. This move poisons or paralyzes opponents.
effect: G-Max Stun Shock is a G-Max Move from Pokémon Sword and Shield, exclusive to Toxtricity. Electric type moves turn into G-Max Stun Shock during Gigantamax. G-Max Stun Shock deals damage and poisons or paralyzes each opponent.

name: G-Max Sweetness
description: A Grass-type attack that Gigantamax Appletun use. This move heals the status conditions of allies.
effect: G-Max Sweetness is a G-Max Move from Pokémon Sword and Shield, exclusive to Appletun. Grass type moves turn into G-Max Sweetness during Gigantamax. G-Max Sweetness deals damage and heals any status conditions of the user and its teammates.

name: G-Max Tartness
description: A Grass-type attack that Gigantamax Flapple use. This move reduces the opponents’ evasiveness.
effect: G-Max Tartness is a G-Max Move from Pokémon Sword and Shield, exclusive to Flapple. Grass type moves turn into G-Max Tartness during Gigantamax. G-Max Tartness deals damage and reduces the evasiveness of all opponents.

name: G-Max Terror
description: A Ghost-type attack that Gigantamax Gengar use. This Pokémon steps on the opposing Pokémon’s shadow to prevent them from escaping.
effect: G-Max Terror is a G-Max Move from Pokémon Sword and Shield, exclusive to Gengar. Ghost type moves turn into G-Max Terror during Gigantamax. G-Max Terror deals damage and prevents the opponent from switching out.

name: G-Max Volcalith
description: A Rock-type attack that Gigantamax Coalossal use. This move continues to deal damage to opponents for four turns.
effect: G-Max Volcalith is a G-Max Move from Pokémon Sword and Shield, exclusive to Coalossal. Rock type moves turn into G-Max Volcalith during Gigantamax. G-Max Volcalith deals damage for 4 turns.

name: G-Max Volt Crash
description: An Electric-type attack that Gigantamax Pikachu use. This move paralyzes opponents.
effect: G-Max Volt Crash is a G-Max Move from Pokemon Sword and Shield, exclusive to Pikachu. Electric type moves turn into G-Max Volt Crash during Gigantamax. G-Max Volt Crash deals damage and paralyzes all opponents.

name: G-Max Wildfire
description: A Fire-type attack that Gigantamax Charizard use. This move continues to deal damage to opponents for four turns.
effect: G-Max Wildfire is a G-Max Move from Pokemon Sword and Shield, exclusive to Charizard. Fire type moves turn into G-Max Wildfire during Gigantamax. G-Max Wildfire deals damage and continues to damage all non-Fire type opponents for 4 turns.

name: G-Max Wind Rage
description: A Flying-type attack that Gigantamax Corviknight use. This move removes the effects of moves like Reflect and Light Screen.
effect: G-Max Wind Rage is a G-Max Move from Pokemon Sword and Shield, exclusive to Corviknight. Flying type moves turn into G-Max Wind Rage during Gigantamax. G-Max Wind Rage removes the effects of all battlefield hazards, including Reflect, Light Screen, Spikes, and Terrain conditions.

name: Gastro Acid
description: The user hurls up its stomach acids on the target. The fluid eliminates the effect of the target’s Ability.
effect: Cancels out the effect of the opponent's Ability.

name: Gear Grind
description: The user attacks by throwing steel gears at its target twice.
effect:
Gear Grind deals damage and will strike twice (with 50 base power each time).
Each strike of Gear Grind is treated like a separate attack:

name: Gear Up
description: The user engages its gears to raise the Attack and Sp. Atk stats of ally Pokémon with the Plus or Minus Ability.
effect: The user engages its gears to raise the Attack and Sp. Atk stats of ally Pokémon with the Plus or Minus Ability.

name: Genesis Supernova
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Genesis Supernova is a Psychic type Z-move exclusive to Mew. It is used with the move Psychic.

name: Geomancy
description: The user absorbs energy and sharply raises its Sp. Atk, Sp. Def, and Speed stats on the next turn.
effect: Geomancy charges on the first turn. On the second turn it raises the user's Special Attack, Special Defense and Speed by two stages each. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. Geomancy is the signature move of Xerneas. In battle, rainbow-colored light erupts from the ground around the user.

name: Giga Drain
description: A nutrient-draining attack. The user’s HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.
effect: Giga Drain deals damage and the user will recover 50% of the HP drained. If the user is holding a Big Root, the move instead recovers 65% of the damage dealt (30% more than normal). If used on a Pokémon with the ability Liquid Ooze, the user instead loses the HP it would have otherwise gained.

name: Giga Impact
description: The user charges at the target using every bit of its power. The user can’t move on the next turn.
effect: Giga Impact deals damage, but the user must recharge on the next turn (bringing its effective power down to 75 per turn). If the user has the ability Truant, it will recharge in the same turn that it loafs around. Giga Impact is the Physical counterpart to Hyper Beam.

name: Gigavolt Havoc
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Gigavolt Havoc is the Electric type Z-Move, introduced in Pokémon Sun/Moon.

name: Glaciate
description: The user attacks by blowing freezing cold air at opposing Pokémon. This lowers their Speed stats.
effect: Glaciate deals damage and lowers the target's Speed by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Glare
description: The user intimidates the target with the pattern on its belly to cause paralysis.
effect: Glare paralyzes the target, if it hits. Paralyzed Pokémon have a 25% chance of not being able to attack, and their Speed is decreased by 50% (75% in Generations 1-6). Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.

name: Glitzy Glow
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Glitzy Glow deals damage and reduces damage from Special attacks by 50%, for 5 turns (similar to Light Screen). Glitzy Glow is an Eevee-exclusive tutor move from Pokémon Let's Go, along with Bouncy Bubble, Buzzy Buzz, Sizzly Slide, Baddy Bad, Sappy Seed, Freezy Frost, and Sparkly Swirl.

name: Grass Knot
description: The user snares the target with grass and trips it. The heavier the target, the greater the move’s power.

name: Grass Pledge
description: A column of grass hits the target. When used with its water equivalent, its power increases and a vast swamp appears.
effect: Grass Pledge deals damage at base power 80. If a teammate uses Fire Pledge or Water Pledge in the same turn, the moves combine into one attack of base power 160 and added effects appear. The faster Pokémon moves first but waits for the other Pokémon to make their move. When the slower Pledge user moves, the combo attack hits the Pokémon the slower user was targeting. If Grass Pledge is used with Fire Pledge, the move animation shows Fire Pledge and a sea of fire envelops the foe's team is created that damages opponents 1⁄8 of their maximum HP each turn, for 4 turns. If Grass Pledge is used with Water Pledge, the move animation shows Grass Pledge and a swamp envelops the foe's team that halves the opponents' speed for 4 turns.

name: Grass Whistle
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Grass Whistle puts the target to sleep, if it hits. Sleeping Pokémon cannot move (with some exceptions such as Snore). Sleep lasts for 1-3 turns. Pokémon with the abilities Insomnia or Vital Spirit, or those behind a Substitute cannot be put to sleep.

name: Grassy Terrain
description: The user turns the ground to grass for five turns. This restores the HP of Pokémon on the ground a little every turn and powers up Grass-type moves.
effect: Grassy Terrain creates a low-lying grassy field lasting 5 turns, that restores the HP of grounded Pokémon each turn, by 1⁄16 of their maximum HP. The power of Grass type moves also increases by 50% while in effect, and the moves Earthquake, Magnitude, and Bulldoze halve in power. Grounded Pokémon are simply those that are not raised. Raised Pokémon are any Flying types or those under the effects of Levitate, Magnet Rise or Telekinesis. Full details in glossary. Grassy Terrain is a terrain condition and can coexist at the same time as weather conditions, but not other terrain conditions. The move Nature Power turns into Energy Ball under Grassy Terrain.

name: Grav Apple
description: The user inflicts damage by dropping an apple from high above. This also lowers the target’s Defense stat.
effect: Lowers the opponent's Defense stat.

name: Gravity
description: This move enables Flying-type Pokémon or Pokémon with the Levitate Ability to be hit by Ground-type moves. Moves that involve flying can’t be used.
effect: Prevents moves like Fly and Bounce and the Ability Levitate for 5 turns.

name: Growl
description: The user growls in an endearing way, making opposing Pokémon less wary. This lowers their Attack stats.
effect: Growl lowers the target's Attack by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Growth
description: The user’s body grows all at once, raising the Attack and Sp. Atk stats.
effect: Growth raises the user's Attack and Special Attack by one stage each. During harsh sunlight it raises each stat by two stages. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Grudge
description: If the user faints, the user’s grudge fully depletes the PP of the opponent’s move that knocked it out.
effect: If the users faints after using this move, the PP for the opponent's last move is depleted.

name: Guard Split
description: The user employs its psychic power to average its Defense and Sp. Def stats with those of the target.
effect: Guard Split averages the user's Defense and Special Defense with those of the target. Stat boosts are not taken into account. For example, if the user's Defense was 100, the opponent's was 200, and the opponent had used Screech on the user, then both Pokémon would end up with 150 Defense. Due to the stat drop, the Guard Split user's effective Defense would now be 75 (instead of the 50 it was originally).

name: Guard Swap
description: The user employs its psychic power to switch changes to its Defense and Sp. Def stats with the target.
effect: User and opponent swap Defense and Special Defense.

name: Guardian of Alola
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Guardian of Alola is a Z-move exclusive to the guardian deities of Alola - Tapu Koko, Tapu Lele, Tapu Bulu and Tapu Fini. It is used with Nature's Madness. Guardian of Alola cuts the target's HP by 75% of its remaining HP.

name: Guillotine
description: A vicious, tearing attack with big pincers. The target faints instantly if this attack hits.
effect: If it hits, Guillotine is guaranteed to make the opponent faint. It is more likely to hit Pokémon that are of a lower level than the user. Its accuracy (as a percentage) is calculated as below, ignoring all other accuracy and evasion modifiers:

name: Gunk Shot
description: The user shoots filthy garbage at the target to attack. This may also poison the target.
effect: Gunk Shot deals damage and has a 30% chance of poisoning the target. Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned.

name: Gust
description: A gust of wind is whipped up by wings and launched at the target to inflict damage.
effect: Gust deals damage with no additional effect. However, it can hit Pokémon during the invulnerable stages of Bounce, Fly and Sky Drop - and in the case of Bounce and Fly, inflicts double damage.

name: Gyro Ball
description: The user tackles the target with a high-speed spin. The slower the user compared to the target, the greater the move’s power.
effect: Gyro Ball inflicts varying damage: the slower the user compared to the opponent, the higher the damage, up to a maximum base power of 150. The base power is calculated as:

name: Hail
description: The user summons a hailstorm lasting five turns. It damages all Pokémon except Ice types.
effect: Hail creates a hailstorm that lasts for 5 turns and induces these additional effects:

name: Hammer Arm
description: The user swings and hits with its strong, heavy fist. It lowers the user’s Speed, however.
effect: Hammer Arm deals damage but lowers the user's Speed by one stage after attacking. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Happy Hour
description: Using Happy Hour doubles the amount of prize money received after battle.
effect: Happy Hour has no battle effect. Instead, it doubles the prize money awarded to the player at the end of the battle. If the Amulet Coin or Luck Incense is held by any Pokémon in battle, and any Pokémon uses Happy Hour during the battle, the prize money is quadrupled. Happy Hour is an event-exclusive move known by Inkay from a Japanese event.

name: Harden
description: The user stiffens all the muscles in its body to raise its Defense stat.
effect: Harden raises the user's Defense by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Haze
description: The user creates a haze that eliminates every stat change among all the Pokémon engaged in battle.
effect: Resets all stat changes.

name: Head Charge
description: The user charges its head into its target, using its powerful guard hair. This also damages the user a little.
effect: Head Charge deals damage, but the user receives 1⁄4 of the damage it inflicts in recoil. In other words, if the attack does 100 HP damage to the opponent, the user will lose 25 HP.

name: Head Smash
description: The user attacks the target with a hazardous, full-power headbutt. This also damages the user terribly.
effect: Head Smash deals damage, but the user receives 1⁄2 of the damage it inflicts in recoil. In other words, if the attack does 100 HP damage to the opponent, the user will lose 50 HP.

name: Headbutt
description: The user sticks out its head and attacks by charging straight into the target. This may also make the target flinch.
effect: Headbutt deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved). Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.

name: Heal Bell
description: The user makes a soothing bell chime to heal the status conditions of all the party Pokémon.
effect: Heals the user's party's status conditions.

name: Heal Block
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Prevents the opponent from restoring HP for 5 turns.

name: Heal Order
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Heal Order recovers up to 50% of the user's maximum HP.

name: Heal Pulse
description: The user emits a healing pulse that restores the target’s HP by up to half of its max HP.
effect: Heal Pulse restores half of the target's maximum HP. It can be used on team-mates but not on itself.

name: Healing Wish
description: The user faints. In return, the Pokémon taking its place will have its HP restored and status conditions cured.
effect: The user faints and the next Pokémon released is fully healed.

name: Heart Stamp
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Heart Stamp deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved). Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.

name: Heart Swap
description: The user employs its psychic power to switch stat changes with the target.
effect: Stat changes are swapped with the opponent.

name: Heat Crash
description: The user slams its target with its flame-covered body. The more the user outweighs the target, the greater the move’s power.

name: Heat Wave
description: The user attacks by exhaling hot breath on opposing Pokémon. This may also leave those Pokémon with a burn.
effect: Heat Wave deals damage and has a 10% chance of burning the target. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned.

name: Heavy Slam
description: The user slams into the target with its heavy body. The more the user outweighs the target, the greater the move’s power.

name: Helping Hand
description: The user assists an ally by boosting the power of that ally’s attack.
effect: In Double Battles, boosts the power of the partner's move.

name: Hex
description: This relentless attack does massive damage to a target affected by status conditions.
effect: Hex inflicts damage, but if the target has a major status ailment (i.e. is burned, poisoned, paralyzed, asleep or frozen) it will double in power to 130.

name: Hidden Power
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Hidden Power deals damage, however its type varies for every Pokémon, depending on that Pokémon's Individual Values (IVs). This makes it a useful move for coverage - giving the Pokémon a type of move they don't normally have. Hidden Power can be any type except Normal or Fairy. It receives STAB if the user's type matches the type given to Hidden Power. Individual Values are 6 hidden numbers (one for each stat) that are randomly generated upon encountering a Pokémon. It is not possible to find your exact IVs in-game. You can find the type of Hidden Power in-game by talking to a particular character who will state the type a Pokémon's Hidden Power would be if it learned the move. They are located at:

name: High Horsepower
description: The user fiercely attacks the target using its entire body.
effect: The user fiercely attacks the target using its entire body.

name: High Jump Kick
description: The target is attacked with a knee kick from a jump. If it misses, the user is hurt instead.
effect: High Jump Kick deals damage, however, if it misses the user keeps going and crashes, losing 1⁄2 of its maximum HP. High Jump Kick cannot be used if Gravity is in effect.

name: Hold Back
description: The user holds back when it attacks, and the target is left with at least 1 HP.
effect: Always leaves opponent with at least 1 HP.

name: Hold Hands
description: The user and an ally hold hands. This makes them very happy.
effect: Makes the user and an ally very happy.

name: Hone Claws
description: The user sharpens its claws to boost its Attack stat and accuracy.
effect: Hone Claws raises the user's Attack and Accuracy by one stage each. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Horn Attack
description: The target is jabbed with a sharply pointed horn to inflict damage.
effect: Horn Attack deals damage with no additional effect.

name: Horn Drill
description: The user stabs the target with a horn that rotates like a drill. The target faints instantly if this attack hits.
effect: If it hits, Horn Drill is guaranteed to make the opponent faint. It is more likely to hit Pokémon that are of a lower level than the user. Its accuracy (as a percentage) is calculated as below, ignoring all other accuracy and evasion modifiers:

name: Horn Leech
description: The user drains the target’s energy with its horns. The user’s HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.
effect: Horn Leech deals damage and the user will recover 50% of the HP drained.  If the user is holding a Big Root, the move instead recovers 65% of the damage dealt (30% more than normal). If used on a Pokémon with the ability Liquid Ooze, the user instead loses the HP it would have otherwise gained.

name: Howl
description: The user howls loudly to raise the spirit of itself and allies. This raises their Attack stats.
effect: Howl raises the user's Attack by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Hurricane
description: The user attacks by wrapping its opponent in a fierce wind that flies up into the sky. This may also confuse the target.
effect: Hurricane deals damage and has a 30% chance of confusing the target. Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused. If used during rain, Hurricane ignores accuracy. Conversely, if used during intense sunlight, its accuracy drops to 50%. Hurricane can hit Pokémon in the invulnerable stage of Fly and Bounce.

name: Hydro Cannon
description: The target is hit with a watery blast. The user can’t move on the next turn.
effect: User must recharge next turn.

name: Hydro Pump
description: The target is blasted by a huge volume of water launched under great pressure.
effect: Hydro Pump deals damage with no additional effect.

name: Hydro Vortex
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Hydro Vortex is the Water type Z-Move, introduced in Pokémon Sun/Moon.

name: Hyper Beam
description: The target is attacked with a powerful beam. The user can’t move on the next turn.
effect: Hyper Beam deals damage, but the user must recharge on the next turn (bringing its effective power down to 75 per turn). If the user has the ability Truant, it will recharge in the same turn that it loafs around. Hyper Beam is the Special counterpart to Giga Impact.

name: Hyper Fang
description: The user bites hard on the target with its sharp front fangs. This may also make the target flinch.
effect: Hyper Fang deals damage and has a 10% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved). Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.

name: Hyper Voice
description: The user lets loose a horribly echoing shout with the power to inflict damage.
effect:
Hyper Voice deals damage with no additional effect, besides targeting multiple foes.
Hyper Voice has no effect on Pokémon with the ability Soundproof.

name: Hyperspace Fury
description: Using its many arms, the user unleashes a barrage of attacks that ignore the effects of moves like Protect and Detect. But the user’s Defense stat falls.
effect: Hyperspace Fury deals damage but lowers the user's Defense by one stage after attacking. The move always hits, even if the target used a Protect-like move. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. Hyperspace Fury is the signature move of Hoopa Unbound.

name: Hyperspace Hole
description: Using a hyperspace hole, the user appears right next to the target and strikes. This also hits a target using a move such as Protect or Detect.
effect: Hyperspace Hole deals damage and always hits, even if the target used a Protect-like move. It is the signature move of Hoopa.

name: Hypnosis
description: The user employs hypnotic suggestion to make the target fall into a deep sleep.
effect: Hypnosis puts the target to sleep, if it hits. Sleeping Pokémon cannot move (with some exceptions such as Snore). Sleep lasts for 1-3 turns. Pokémon with the abilities Insomnia or Vital Spirit, or those behind a Substitute cannot be put to sleep.

name: Ice Ball
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Ice Ball deals damage for 5 turns, doubling in power each turn. The move stops if it misses on any turn. If it doesn't miss, Ice Ball will deal 30, 60, 120, 240 and 480 base power damage each turn respectively. If the user has used Defense Curl in any previous turn (without switching out) then Ice Ball doubles in power, i.e. it will deal 60, 120, 240, 480 and 960 base power damage respectively. As Ice Ball has 90% accuracy, the chances of it being successful for each turn (with normal Accuracy/Evasion and no other interruptions) are 90%, 81%, 73%, 66% and 59% respectively. In other words, roughly 3 out of every 5 times Ice Ball is used, it will hit for the full 5 turns.

name: Ice Beam
description: The target is struck with an icy-cold beam of energy. This may also leave the target frozen.
effect: Ice Beam deals damage and has a 10% chance of freezing the target. Ice type Pokémon, those with the ability Magma Armor or those behind a Substitute cannot be frozen.

name: Ice Burn
description: On the second turn, an ultracold, freezing wind surrounds the target. This may leave the target with a burn.
effect: The user of Ice Burn will charge on the first turn. On the second turn, it deals damage and has a 30% chance of burning the target. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned. If the user is holding a Power Herb, Ice Burn executes in one turn.

name: Ice Fang
description: The user bites with cold-infused fangs. This may also make the target flinch or leave it frozen.
effect: Ice Fang deals damage, has a 10% chance of freezing the target and has a 10% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved). Ice type Pokémon, those with the ability Magma Armor or those behind a Substitute cannot be frozen. Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.

name: Ice Hammer
description: The user swings and hits with its strong, heavy fist. It lowers the user’s Speed, however.
effect: The user swings and hits with its strong, heavy fist. It lowers the user's Speed, however.

name: Ice Punch
description: The target is punched with an icy fist. This may also leave the target frozen.
effect: Ice Punch deals damage and has a 10% chance of freezing the target. Ice type Pokémon, those with the ability Magma Armor or those behind a Substitute cannot be frozen.

name: Ice Shard
description: The user flash-freezes chunks of ice and hurls them at the target. This move always goes first.
effect: Ice Shard deals damage and has a priority of +1. Moves with a higher priority always go first, regardless of a Pokémon's speed. If two moves with the same priority are used, the faster Pokémon goes first as usual.

name: Icicle Crash
description: The user attacks by harshly dropping large icicles onto the target. This may also make the target flinch.
effect: Icicle Crash deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved). Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.

name: Icicle Spear
description: The user launches sharp icicles at the target two to five times in a row.

name: Icy Wind
description: The user attacks with a gust of chilled air. This also lowers opposing Pokémon’s Speed stats.
effect: Icy Wind deals damage and lowers the target's Speed by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Imprison
description: If opposing Pokémon know any move also known by the user, they are prevented from using it.
effect: Opponent is unable to use moves that the user also knows.

name: Incinerate
description: The user attacks opposing Pokémon with fire. If a Pokémon is holding a certain item, such as a Berry, the item becomes burned up and unusable.
effect: Incinerate deals damage and if the target is holding a Berry, it is burnt and becomes no longer usable. If Incinerate would be super-effective and the target is holding an Occa Berry, the Berry activates before the move hits so does not get burnt.

name: Inferno
description: The user attacks by engulfing the target in an intense fire. This leaves the target with a burn.
effect: Inferno deals damage and burns the target, if it hits. Burned Pokémon lose 1⁄8 of their maximum HP each turn and their Attack is decreased by 50%. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned.

name: Inferno Overdrive
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Inferno Overdrive is the Fire type Z-Move, introduced in Pokémon Sun/Moon.

name: Infestation
description: The target is infested and attacked for four to five turns. The target can’t flee during this time.
effect: Infestation inflicts damage on the first turn then traps the opponent, causing them to lose 1⁄8 of their maximum HP after each turn, for 4-5 turns. If the user holds a Grip Claw, the after-effects last for 7 turns. If a Binding Band is held, the damage is 1⁄6 of the target's maximum HP.

name: Ingrain
description: The user lays roots that restore its HP on every turn. Because it’s rooted, it can’t switch out.
effect: The user of Ingrain plants it roots, which restores 1⁄16 of its maximum HP at the end of each turn, but prevents switching out. Only the moves Baton Pass, U Turn or Volt Switch will allow the user to switch out, with Baton Pass transferring the effects of Ingrain. Moves such as Roar used on this Pokémon will have no effect. Ingrain cancels effects given to raised Pokémon such as immunity to Ground-type moves, Spikes and so on. See more in the glossary. If the user is holding a Big Root, Ingrain restores 30% more HP each turn - approximately 1⁄12 of its maximum.

name: Instruct
description: The user instructs the target to use the target’s last move again.
effect: Instruct tells the user's teammate in a double/triple battle to use its most recent move instead of them. In other words, it allows a teammate to attack twice instead of the two Pokémon attacking once each.

name: Ion Deluge
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Ion Deluge changes Normal-type moves to Electric-type for all Pokémon on the field, for the remainder of the turn.

name: Iron Defense
description: The user hardens its body’s surface like iron, sharply raising its Defense stat.
effect: Iron Defense raises the user's Defense by two stages. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Iron Head
description: The user slams the target with its steel-hard head. This may also make the target flinch.
effect: Iron Head deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved). Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.

name: Iron Tail
description: The target is slammed with a steel-hard tail. This may also lower the target’s Defense stat.
effect: Iron Tail deals damage and has a 30% chance of lowering the target's Defense by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Jaw Lock
description: This move prevents the user and the target from switching out until either of them faints. The effect goes away if either of the Pokémon leaves the field.
effect: Prevents user and opponent from switching out.

name: Judgment
description: The user releases countless shots of light at the target. This move’s type varies depending on the kind of Plate the user is holding.
effect: Type depends on the Arceus Plate being held.

name: Jump Kick
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Jump Kick deals damage, however, if it misses the user keeps going and crashes, losing 1⁄2 of its maximum HP. Jump Kick cannot be used if Gravity is in effect.

name: Karate Chop
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Karate Chop deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio (1⁄8 instead of 1⁄16).

name: Kinesis
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Kinesis lowers the target's Accuracy by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. Pokémon with the abilities Keen Eye, Clear Body or White Smoke cannot have their accuracy reduced.

name: King's Shield
description: The user takes a defensive stance while it protects itself from damage. It also lowers the Attack stat of any attacker that makes direct contact.
effect: King's Shield prevents any Physical or Special attacks targeted at the user from striking, for the duration of the turn. If a contact move is targeted at the King's Shield user, the opponent's Attack is lowered by two stages. It has priority +4 so will activate before most other moves. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. The accuracy of King's Shield drops by 1⁄3 each time it is used consecutively after itself or Protect, Detect, Endure, Wide Guard, Quick Guard, Spiky Shield, or Baneful Bunker.

name: Knock Off
description: The user slaps down the target’s held item, and that item can’t be used in that battle. The move does more damage if the target has a held item.
effect: Knock Off deals damage and if the target has a held item, damage is increased by 50% (i.e. 97.5 base power) and the item is removed for the remainder of the battle (switching out does not restore the item). All items are restored at the end of a battle. If the item would activate on attack (e.g. Focus Band), it does so before being stolen. If the item is consumable on attack (e.g. Focus Sash) then the item is consumed as normal and cannot be stolen. Pokemon with the ability Sticky Hold cannot have their held item removed. The Griseous Orb cannot be removed from Giratina; Type Plates cannot be removed from Arceus; Drives cannot be removed from Genesect; and Mega Stones cannot be removed from their respective Pokémon. Note that in these cases the damage dealt does not increase.

name: Land's Wrath
description: The user gathers the energy of the land and focuses that power on opposing Pokémon to damage them.
effect: Land's Wrath deals damage with no additional effects.

name: Laser Focus
description: The user concentrates intensely. The attack on the next turn always results in a critical hit.
effect: User's next attack is guaranteed to result in a critical hit.

name: Last Resort
description: This move can be used only after the user has used all the other moves it knows in the battle.
effect: Last Resort deals high damage, but will fail if the user has not used each of its other moves at least once (or has no other moves). If the user switches out, the move gets reset and when it switches back in, will need to use each of its other moves at least once in order to use Last Resort again.

name: Lava Plume
description: The user torches everything around it in an inferno of scarlet flames. This may also leave those it hits with a burn.
effect: Lava Plume deals damage and has a 30% chance of burning the target. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned.

name: Leaf Blade
description: The user handles a sharp leaf like a sword and attacks by cutting its target. Critical hits land more easily.
effect: Leaf Blade deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio (1⁄8 instead of 1⁄16).

name: Leaf Storm
description: The user whips up a storm of leaves around the target. The attack’s recoil harshly lowers the user’s Sp. Atk stat.
effect: Leaf Storm deals damage but lowers the user's Special Attack by two stages after attacking. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Leaf Tornado
description: The user attacks its target by encircling it in sharp leaves. This attack may also lower the target’s accuracy.
effect: Leaf Tornado deals damage and has a 30% chance of lowering the target's Accuracy by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. Pokémon with the abilities Keen Eye, Clear Body or White Smoke cannot have their accuracy reduced.

name: Leafage
description: The user attacks by pelting the target with leaves.
effect: Strikes opponent with leaves.

name: Leech Life
description: The user drains the target’s blood. The user’s HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.
effect: Leech Life deals damage and the user will recover 50% of the HP drained. If the user is holding a Big Root, the move instead recovers 65% of the damage dealt (30% more than normal). If used on a Pokémon with the ability Liquid Ooze, the user instead loses the HP it would have otherwise gained.

name: Leech Seed
description: A seed is planted on the target. It steals some HP from the target every turn.
effect: Leech Seed plants a seed on the target that drains 1⁄8 of its maximum HP at the end of each turn and restores it to the user, or any Pokémon that takes its place. It does not work on Grass-type Pokémon; it does technically work against Pokémon with the Magic Guard ability, but no HP will be sapped. If the user is holding a Big Root, the move still saps the same amount of HP but recovers 30% more than normal. For example, if a Pokémon has 320 HP, Leech Seed would cause them to lose 40 HP each turn but the seeder would recover 52 HP. If used on a Pokémon with the ability Liquid Ooze, the user instead loses the HP it would have otherwise gained. The seeded Pokémon can clear Leech Seed by switching out or using Rapid Spin.

name: Leer
description: The user gives opposing Pokémon an intimidating leer that lowers the Defense stat.
effect: Leer lowers the target's Defense by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Let's Snuggle Forever
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Let's Snuggle Forever is a Fairy type Z-Move exclusive to Mimikyu. It is used with Play Rough.

name: Lick
description: The target is licked with a long tongue, causing damage. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
effect: Lick deals damage and has a 30% chance of paralyzing the target. Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.

name: Life Dew
description: The user scatters mysterious water around and restores the HP of itself and its ally Pokémon in the battle.
effect: Life Dew recovers up to 25% of the user's and its teammate's maximum HP.

name: Light of Ruin
description: Drawing power from the Eternal Flower, the user fires a powerful beam of light. This also damages the user quite a lot.
effect: Light of Ruin deals damage, but the user receives 1⁄2 of the damage it inflicted in recoil. In other words, if the attack does 100 HP damage to the opponent, the user will lose 50 HP.

name: Light Screen
description: A wondrous wall of light is put up to reduce damage from special attacks for five turns.
effect: Light Screen reduces damage from Special attacks by 50%, for 5 turns. Its effects apply to all Pokémon on the user's side of the field. If the user is holding Light Clay when Light Screen is used, its effects last for 8 turns. The move Brick Break, when used against an Pokémon under Light Screen's effect, will remove the screen before dealing damage. The ability Infiltrator bypasses the effects of Light Screen. Light Screen is the Special counterpart to Reflect.

name: Light That Burns the Sky
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Light That Burns the Sky is a Psychic type Z-Move exclusive to Necrozma. It is used with Photon Geyser. Light That Burns the Sky ignores target's ability and inflicts damage based on the user's Attack or Special Attack, whichever is higher.

name: Liquidation
description: The user slams into the target using a full-force blast of water. This may also lower the target’s Defense stat.
effect: The user slams into the target using a full-force blast of water. This may also lower the target's Defense stat.

name: Lock-On
description: The user takes sure aim at the target. This ensures the next attack does not miss the target.
effect: User's next attack is guaranteed to hit.

name: Lovely Kiss
description: With a scary face, the user tries to force a kiss on the target. If it succeeds, the target falls asleep.
effect: Lovely Kiss puts the target to sleep, if it hits. Sleeping Pokémon cannot move (with some exceptions such as Snore). Sleep lasts for 1-3 turns. Pokémon with the abilities Insomnia or Vital Spirit, or those behind a Substitute cannot be put to sleep.

name: Low Kick
description: A powerful low kick that makes the target fall over. The heavier the target, the greater the move’s power.

name: Low Sweep
description: The user makes a swift attack on the target’s legs, which lowers the target’s Speed stat.
effect: Low Sweep deals damage and lowers the target's Speed by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Lucky Chant
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Opponent cannot land critical hits for 5 turns.

name: Lunar Dance
description: The user faints. In return, the Pokémon taking its place will have its status and HP fully restored.
effect: The user faints but the next Pokémon released is fully healed.

name: Lunge
description: The user makes a lunge at the target, attacking with full force. This also lowers the target’s Attack stat.
effect: The user makes a lunge at the target, attacking with full force. This also lowers the target's Attack stat.

name: Luster Purge
description: The user lets loose a damaging burst of light. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.
effect: Luster Purge deals damage and has a 50% chance of lowering the target's Special Defense by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Mach Punch
description: The user throws a punch at blinding speed. This move always goes first.
effect: Mach Punch deals damage and has a priority of +1. Moves with a higher priority always go first, regardless of a Pokémon's speed. If two moves with the same priority are used, the faster Pokémon goes first as usual.

name: Magic Coat
description: Moves like Leech Seed and moves that inflict status conditions are blocked by a barrier and reflected back to the user of those moves.
effect: Magic Coat reflects any move causing status conditions - for example Thunder Wave or Toxic - back to the attacker. It applies only to the turn it is used.

name: Magic Powder
description: The user scatters a cloud of magic powder that changes the target to Psychic type.
effect: Changes target's type to Psychic.

name: Magic Room
description: The user creates a bizarre area in which Pokémon’s held items lose their effects for five turns.
effect: Magic Room suppresses the effects of held items for all Pokémon for five turns.

name: Magical Leaf
description: The user scatters curious leaves that chase the target. This attack never misses.
effect: Magical Leaf deals damage and ignores changes to the Accuracy and Evasion stats. However, it will not hit Pokémon during the invulnerable stage of Bounce, Dig, Dive, Fly, Shadow Force or Sky Drop.

name: Magma Storm
description: The target becomes trapped within a maelstrom of fire that rages for four to five turns.
effect: Magma Storm inflicts damage on the first turn then traps the opponent, causing them to lose 1⁄8 of their maximum HP after each turn, for 4-5 turns. If the user holds a Grip Claw, the after-effects last for 7 turns. If a Binding Band is held, the damage is 1⁄6 of the target's maximum HP.

name: Magnet Bomb
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Magnet Bomb deals damage and ignores changes to the Accuracy and Evasion stats. However, it will not hit Pokémon during the invulnerable stage of Bounce, Dig, Dive, Fly, Shadow Force or Sky Drop.

name: Magnet Rise
description: The user levitates using electrically generated magnetism for five turns.
effect: User becomes immune to Ground-type moves for 5 turns.

name: Magnetic Flux
description: The user manipulates magnetic fields, which raises the Defense and Sp. Def stats of ally Pokémon with the Plus or Minus Ability.
effect: Magnetic Flux raises the Defense and Special Defense of ally Pokémon with the Plus or Minus abilities.

name: Magnitude
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.

name: Malicious Moonsault
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Malicious Moonsault is a Dark type Z-move exclusive to Incineroar. It is used with Incineroar's signature move Darkest Lariat. If the target has used Minimize, Malicious Moonsault ignores accuracy and deals double damage.

name: Mat Block
description: Using a pulled-up mat as a shield, the user protects itself and its allies from damaging moves. This does not stop status moves.
effect: Mat Block protects the user's team from Physical or Special category moves, but not Status moves. It only works on the first turn the user is in battle.

name: Max Airstream
description: This is a Flying-type attack Dynamax Pokémon use. This raises ally Pokémon’s Speed stats.
effect: Max Airstream is a Dynamax move from Pokémon Sword and Shield. Flying type moves turn into Max Airstream during Dynamax. The move deals damage and raises the Speed of the user and its teammates.

name: Max Darkness
description: This is a Dark-type attack Dynamax Pokémon use. This lowers the target’s Sp. Def stat.
effect: Max Darkness is a Dynamax move from Pokémon Sword and Shield. Dark type moves turn into Max Darkness during Dynamax. The move deals damage and lowers the target's Special Defense.

name: Max Flare
description: This is a Fire-type attack Dynamax Pokémon use. The user intensifies the sun for five turns.
effect: Max Flare is a Dynamax move from Pokémon Sword and Shield. Fire type moves turn into Max Flare during Dynamax. The move deals damage and summons the harsh sunlight for 5 turns.

name: Max Flutterby
description: This is a Bug-type attack Dynamax Pokémon use. This lowers the target’s Sp. Atk stat.
effect: Max Flutterby is a Dynamax move from Pokémon Sword and Shield. Bug type moves turn into Max Flutterby during Dynamax. The move deals damage and lowers the target's Special Attack.

name: Max Geyser
description: This is a Water-type attack Dynamax Pokémon use. The user summons a heavy rain that falls for five turns.
effect: Max Geyser is a Dynamax move from Pokémon Sword and Shield. Water type moves turn into Max Geyser during Dynamax. The move deals damage and summons heavy rain for 5 turns.

name: Max Guard
description: This move enables the user to protect itself from all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used in succession.
effect: Max Guard is a Dynamax move from Pokémon Sword and Shield. Status category moves turn into Max Guard during Dynamax. The move protects the user from attacks, like Protect.

name: Max Hailstorm
description: This is an Ice-type attack Dynamax Pokémon use. The user summons a hailstorm lasting five turns.
effect: Max Hailstorm is a Dynamax move from Pokémon Sword and Shield. Ice type moves turn into Max Hailstorm during Dynamax. The move deals damage and summons hail for 5 turns.

name: Max Knuckle
description: This is a Fighting-type attack Dynamax Pokémon use. This raises ally Pokémon’s Attack stats.
effect: Max Knuckle is a Dynamax move from Pokémon Sword and Shield. Fighting type moves turn into Max Knuckle during Dynamax. The move deals damage and increases the Attack of the user and its teammates.

name: Max Lightning
description: This is an Electric-type attack Dynamax Pokémon use. The user turns the ground into Electric Terrain for five turns.
effect: Max Lightning is a Dynamax move from Pokémon Sword and Shield. Electric type moves turn into Max Lightning during Dynamax. The move deals damage and summons Electric Terrain for 5 turns.

name: Max Mindstorm
description: This is a Psychic-type attack Dynamax Pokémon use. The user turns the ground into Psychic Terrain for five turns.
effect: Max Overgrowth is a Dynamax move from Pokémon Sword and Shield. Grass type moves turn into Max Overgrowth during Dynamax. The move deals damage and summons Psychic Terrain for 5 turns.

name: Max Ooze
description: This is a Poison-type attack Dynamax Pokémon use. This raises ally Pokémon’s Sp. Atk stats.
effect: Max Ooze is a Dynamax move from Pokémon Sword and Shield. Poison type moves turn into Max Ooze during Dynamax. The move deals damage and increases the Special Attack of the user and its teammates.

name: Max Overgrowth
description: This is a Grass-type attack Dynamax Pokémon use. The user turns the ground into Grassy Terrain for five turns.
effect: Max Overgrowth is a Dynamax move from Pokémon Sword and Shield. Grass type moves turn into Max Overgrowth during Dynamax. The move deals damage and summons Grassy Terrain for 5 turns.

name: Max Phantasm
description: This is a Ghost-type attack Dynamax Pokémon use. This lowers the target’s Defense stat.
effect: Max Phantasm is a Dynamax move from Pokémon Sword and Shield. Ghost type moves turn into Max Phantasm during Dynamax. The move deals damage and lowers the target's Defense.

name: Max Quake
description: This is a Ground-type attack Dynamax Pokémon use. This raises ally Pokémon’s Sp. Def stats.
effect: Max Quake is a Dynamax move from Pokémon Sword and Shield. Ground type moves turn into Max Quake during Dynamax. The move deals damage and increases the Special Defense of the user and its teammates.

name: Max Rockfall
description: This is a Rock-type attack Dynamax Pokémon use. The user summons a sandstorm lasting five turns.
effect: Max Rockfall is a Dynamax move from Pokémon Sword and Shield. Rock type moves turn into Max Rockfall during Dynamax. The move deals damage and summons a sandstorm for 5 turns.

name: Max Starfall
description: This is a Fairy-type attack Dynamax Pokémon use. The user turns the ground into Misty Terrain for five turns.
effect: Max Starfall is a Dynamax move from Pokémon Sword and Shield. Fairy type moves turn into Max Starfall during Dynamax. The move deals damage and summons Misty Terrain for 5 turns.

name: Max Steelspike
description: This is a Steel-type attack Dynamax Pokémon use. This raises ally Pokémon’s Defense stats.
effect: Max Steelspike is a Dynamax move from Pokémon Sword and Shield. Steel type moves turn into Max Steelspike during Dynamax. The move deals damage and raises the Defense of the user and its teammates.

name: Max Strike
description: This is a Normal-type attack Dynamax Pokémon use. This lowers the target’s Speed stat.
effect: Max Strike is a Dynamax move from Pokémon Sword and Shield. Normal type moves turn into Max Strike during Dynamax. The move deals damage and lowers the target's Speed.

name: Max Wyrmwind
description: This is a Dragon-type attack Dynamax Pokémon use. This lowers the target’s Attack stat.
effect: Max Wyrmwind is a Dynamax move from Pokémon Sword and Shield. Dragon type moves turn into Max Wyrmwind during Dynamax. The move deals damage and lowers the target's Attack.

name: Me First
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: If the opponent is readying a direct attack, the user of Me First will try to copy it and attack with 50% more power. The move only works if the user is faster than the opponent or otherwise able to move first (for example a Quick Claw activating). Me First cannot copy Sucker Punch or Fake Out, nor by its definition above, any high priority move such as ExtremeSpeed. However it can copy a multi-turn move from any of its turns.

name: Mean Look
description: The user pins the target with a dark, arresting look. The target becomes unable to flee.
effect: Opponent cannot flee or switch.

name: Meditate
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Meditate raises the user's Attack by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Mega Drain
description: A nutrient-draining attack. The user’s HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.
effect: Mega Drain deals damage and the user will recover 50% of the HP drained. If the user is holding a Big Root, the move instead recovers 65% of the damage dealt (30% more than normal). If used on a Pokémon with the ability Liquid Ooze, the user instead loses the HP it would have otherwise gained.

name: Mega Kick
description: The target is attacked by a kick launched with muscle-packed power.
effect: Mega Kick deals damage with no additional effect.

name: Mega Punch
description: The target is slugged by a punch thrown with muscle-packed power.
effect: Mega Punch deals damage with no additional effect.

name: Megahorn
description: Using its tough and impressive horn, the user rams into the target with no letup.
effect: Megahorn deals damage with no additional effect.

name: Memento
description: The user faints when using this move. In return, this harshly lowers the target’s Attack and Sp. Atk stats.
effect: User faints, sharply lowers opponent's Attack and Special Attack.

name: Menacing Moonraze Maelstrom
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Menacing Moonraze Maelstrom is a Ghost type Z-Move exclusive to Lunala and Dawn Wings Necrozma, introduced in Pokémon Ultra Sun & Ultra Moon. It is used with Lunala's signature move, Moongeist Beam. Menacing Moonraze Maelstrom deals damage, ignoring the target's ability.

name: Metal Burst
description: The user retaliates with much greater force against the opponent that last inflicted damage on it.
effect: Deals damage equal to 1.5x opponent's attack.

name: Metal Claw
description: The target is raked with steel claws. This may also raise the user’s Attack stat.
effect: Metal Claw deals damage and has a 10% chance of raising the user's Attack by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Metal Sound
description: A horrible sound like scraping metal harshly lowers the target’s Sp. Def stat.
effect: Metal Sound lowers the target's Special Defense by two stages. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Meteor Assault
description: The user attacks wildly with its thick leek. The user can’t move on the next turn, because the force of this move makes it stagger.
effect: User must recharge next turn.

name: Meteor Mash
description: The target is hit with a hard punch fired like a meteor. This may also raise the user’s Attack stat.
effect: Meteor Mash deals damage and has a 20% chance of raising the user's Attack by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Metronome
description: The user waggles a finger and stimulates its brain into randomly using nearly any move.
effect: Metronome uses a random move chosen from nearly all existing moves, even if the user cannot normally learn it. The random move is chosen at the point Metronome is used, so priority moves like Mach Punch will not go first. Although Metronome technically targets the user, the move it turns into will use its usual target (whether the opponent(s), teammate(s) or self), or target a random adjacent opponent in double/triple battles. Metronome will not select a Z-Move or any of the following moves:

name: Milk Drink
description: The user restores its own HP by up to half of its max HP.
effect: Milk Drink recovers up to 50% of the user's maximum HP.

name: Mimic
description: The user copies the target’s last move. The move can be used during battle until the Pokémon is switched out.
effect: Mimic copies the last move used by the target (replacing Mimic). The copied move always has 5 PP. The effect only lasts while the user is in battle: if the user switches out or when the battle ends, the move becomes Mimic again. Mimic cannot copy Chatter, Metronome, Sketch or Struggle.

name: Mind Blown
description: The user attacks everything around it by causing its own head to explode. This also damages the user.
effect: Mind Blown deals damage, but the user sacrifices 1⁄2 of its maximum HP in recoil. It can be learnt by UB Burst.

name: Mind Reader
description: The user senses the target’s movements with its mind to ensure its next attack does not miss the target.
effect: User's next attack is guaranteed to hit.

name: Minimize
description: The user compresses its body to make itself look smaller, which sharply raises its evasiveness.
effect: Minimize raises the user's Evasion by two stages, thus making the user more difficult to hit. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. The following moves deal double damage against a Pokémon that has used Minimize, and bypass accuracy checks:

name: Miracle Eye
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Resets opponent's Evasiveness, removes Dark's Psychic immunity.

name: Mirror Coat
description: A retaliation move that counters any special attack, inflicting double the damage taken.
effect: When hit by a Special Attack, user strikes back with 2x power.

name: Mirror Move
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: User performs the opponent's last move.

name: Mirror Shot
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Mirror Shot deals damage and has a 30% chance of lowering the target's Accuracy by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. Pokémon with the abilities Keen Eye, Clear Body or White Smoke cannot have their accuracy reduced.

name: Mist
description: The user cloaks itself and its allies in a white mist that prevents any of their stats from being lowered for five turns.
effect: User's stats cannot be changed for a period of time.

name: Mist Ball
description: A mist-like flurry of down envelops and damages the target. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Atk stat.
effect: Mist Ball deals damage and has a 50% chance of lowering the target's Special Attack by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Misty Terrain
description: This protects Pokémon on the ground from status conditions and halves damage from Dragon-type moves for five turns.
effect: Misty Terrain creates a low-lying mist lasting 5 turns, that protects all grounded Pokémon from status conditions (including confusion). It also halves the power of Dragon type moves while in effect. Grounded Pokémon are simply those that are not raised. Raised Pokémon are any Flying types or those under the effects of Levitate, Magnet Rise or Telekinesis. Full details in glossary. Misty Terrain is a terrain condition and can coexist at the same time as weather conditions, but not other terrain conditions. The move Nature Power turns into Moonblast under Misty Terrain.

name: Moonblast
description: Borrowing the power of the moon, the user attacks the target. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Atk stat.
effect: Moonblast deals damage and has a 30% chance of lowering the target's Special Attack by one stage.

name: Moongeist Beam
description: The user emits a sinister ray to attack the target. This move can be used on the target regardless of its Abilities.
effect: Ignores the target's ability.

name: Moonlight
description: The user restores its own HP. The amount of HP regained varies with the weather.
effect: The user restores its own HP. The amount of HP regained varies with the weather.

name: Morning Sun
description: The user restores its own HP. The amount of HP regained varies with the weather.
effect: User recovers HP. Amount varies with the weather.

name: Mud Bomb
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Mud Bomb deals damage and has a 30% chance of lowering the target's Accuracy by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. Pokémon with the abilities Keen Eye, Clear Body or White Smoke cannot have their accuracy reduced.

name: Mud Shot
description: The user attacks by hurling a blob of mud at the target. This also lowers the target’s Speed stat.
effect: Mud Shot deals damage and lowers the target's Speed by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Mud Sport
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Mud Sport reduces the power of Electric type moves by 50%. The effect applies to the entire field. Most Pokémon that learn Mud Sport are part Ground type and thus already immune to Electric attacks.

name: Mud-Slap
description: The user hurls mud in the target’s face to inflict damage and lower its accuracy.
effect: Mud-Slap deals damage and lowers the target's Accuracy by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. Pokémon with the abilities Keen Eye, Clear Body or White Smoke cannot have their accuracy reduced.

name: Muddy Water
description: The user attacks by shooting muddy water at opposing Pokémon. This may also lower their accuracy.
effect: Muddy Water deals damage and has a 30% chance of lowering the target's Accuracy by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. Pokémon with the abilities Keen Eye, Clear Body or White Smoke cannot have their accuracy reduced.

name: Multi-Attack
description: Cloaking itself in high energy, the user slams into the target. The memory held determines the move’s type.
effect: Type matches user's current type.

name: Mystical Fire
description: The user attacks by breathing a special, hot fire. This also lowers the target’s Sp. Atk stat.
effect: Mystical Fire deals damage and lowers the target's Special Attack by one stage.

name: Nasty Plot
description: The user stimulates its brain by thinking bad thoughts. This sharply raises the user’s Sp. Atk stat.
effect: Nasty Plot raises the user's Special Attack by two stages. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Natural Gift
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Natural Gift deals damage with no additional effects. However, its type and base power vary depending on the user's held Berry. The grid below shows which Berries provide which power and type. For example, if a Pokémon holding a Cheri Berry uses Natural Gift, it will become a base power 60, Fire-type attack; holding a Starf Berry it will become an 80 power Psychic-type move.

name: Nature Power
description: This attack makes use of nature’s power. Its effects vary depending on the user’s environment.
effect: When Nature Power is used it turns into a different move depending on the current battle terrain, as listed below. Although it's a Normal type move, the user only receives STAB if the move it turns into is their type. For example, Sawsbuck (Normal/Grass) would not obtain STAB if Nature Power turned into Hydro Pump, but Ludicolo would. In double/triple battles, due to the different moves having varying targets Nature Power is set to target the user. However, moves that target multiple Pokémon such as Rock Slide or Earthquake still hit multiple foes and/or teammates as normal. Moves that target a single foe will strike the Pokémon directly opposite the user, or an adjacent foe if there is no Pokémon opposite.

name: Nature's Madness
description: The user hits the target with the force of nature. It halves the target’s HP.
effect: Halves the foe's HP.

name: Needle Arm
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Needle Arm deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved). Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.

name: Never-Ending Nightmare
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Never-Ending Nightmare is the Ghost type Z-Move, introduced in Pokémon Sun/Moon.

name: Night Daze
description: The user lets loose a pitch-black shock wave at its target. This may also lower the target’s accuracy.
effect: Night Daze deals damage and has a 40% chance of lowering the target's Accuracy by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. Pokémon with the abilities Keen Eye, Clear Body or White Smoke cannot have their accuracy reduced.

name: Night Shade
description: The user makes the target see a frightening mirage. It inflicts damage equal to the user’s level.
effect: The damage of Night Shade is equal to the user's level. So at level 100 the Pokémon will inflict 100 HP damage.

name: Night Slash
description: The user slashes the target the instant an opportunity arises. Critical hits land more easily.
effect: Night Slash deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio (1⁄8 instead of 1⁄16).

name: Nightmare
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: If the target is asleep, Nightmare causes it to lose 1⁄4 of its maximum HP after each turn. The status condition is cured when the Pokémon wakes up.

name: No Retreat
description: This move raises all the user’s stats but prevents the user from switching out or fleeing.
effect: Raises all stats but user cannot switch out.

name: Noble Roar
description: Letting out a noble roar, the user intimidates the target and lowers its Attack and Sp. Atk stats.
effect: Noble Roar lowers the target's Attack and Special Attack by one stage each. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Nuzzle
description: The user attacks by nuzzling its electrified cheeks against the target. This also leaves the target with paralysis.
effect: Nuzzle deals damage and paralyzes the target. Paralyzed Pokémon have a 25% chance of not being able to attack, and their Speed is decreased by 50% (75% in Generations 1-6). Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.

name: Oblivion Wing
description: The user absorbs its target’s HP. The user’s HP is restored by over half of the damage taken by the target.
effect: Oblivion Wing deals damage and the user will recover 75% of the HP drained. Oblivion Wing is the signature move of Yveltal. In battle, the user flies high into the sky then releases a beam of red light that scorches the ground.

name: Obstruct
description: This move enables the user to protect itself from all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used in succession. Direct contact harshly lowers the attacker’s Defense stat.
effect: Obstruct prevents any attacks targeted at the user from striking, for the duration of the turn. If a contact move is targeted at the user on that turn, the attacker's Defense is lowered by two stages. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Oceanic Operetta
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Oceanic Operetta is a Water type Z-move exclusive to Primarina. It is used with Primarina's signature move Sparkling Aria.

name: Octazooka
description: The user attacks by spraying ink in the target’s face or eyes. This may also lower the target’s accuracy.
effect: Octazooka deals damage and has a 50% chance of lowering the target's Accuracy by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. Pokémon with the abilities Keen Eye, Clear Body or White Smoke cannot have their accuracy reduced.

name: Octolock
description: The user locks the target in and prevents it from fleeing. This move also lowers the target’s Defense and Sp. Def every turn.
effect: Octolock prevents the target from fleeing or switching out, while the user remains in battle. It also lowers the target's Defense and Special Defense by one stage each every turn. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Odor Sleuth
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Resets opponent's Evasiveness, Normal-type and Fighting-type attacks can now hit Ghosts, and Ghost-type attacks hit Normal.

name: Ominous Wind
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Ominous Wind deals damage and has a 10% chance of raising the user's Attack, Defense, Special Attack, Special Defense and Speed by one stage each. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Origin Pulse
description: The user attacks opposing Pokémon with countless beams of light that glow a deep and brilliant blue.
effect: Origin Pulse deals damage and hits all adjacent opponents in double/triple battles. It is the signature move of Kyogre.

name: Outrage
description: The user rampages and attacks for two to three turns. The user then becomes confused.
effect: The user of Outrage attacks for 2-3 turns, during which it cannot switch out, and then becomes confused. Confused Pokémon have a 33% chance of hurting themselves each turn, for 1-4 attacking turns (50% chance in Generations 1-6). The damage received is as if the Pokémon attacks itself with a typeless 40 base power Physical attack. If Outrage is disrupted (e.g. if the move misses or the user cannot attack due to paralysis) then it will stop and not cause confusion. Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused.

name: Overdrive
description: The user attacks opposing Pokémon by twanging a guitar or bass guitar, causing a huge echo and strong vibration.
effect: Overdrive has no added effects.

name: Overheat
description: The user attacks the target at full power. The attack’s recoil harshly lowers the user’s Sp. Atk stat.
effect: Overheat deals damage but lowers the user's Special Attack by two stages after attacking. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Pain Split
description: The user adds its HP to the target’s HP, then equally shares the combined HP with the target.
effect: The user's and opponent's HP becomes the average of both.

name: Parabolic Charge
description: The user attacks everything around it. The user’s HP is restored by half the damage taken by those hit.
effect: Parabolic Charge deals damage and the user will recover 50% of the HP drained. It targets all adjacent Pokémon.

name: Parting Shot
description: With a parting threat, the user lowers the target’s Attack and Sp. Atk stats. Then it switches with a party Pokémon.
