effect: Parting Shot lowers the opponent's Attack and Special Attack by one stage each, then the user switches out of battle. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Pay Day
description: Numerous coins are hurled at the target to inflict damage. Money is earned after the battle.
effect: A small amount of money is gained after the battle resolves.

name: Payback
description: The user stores power, then attacks. If the user moves after the target, this attack’s power will be doubled.
effect: Power doubles if the user was attacked first.

name: Peck
description: The target is jabbed with a sharply pointed beak or horn.
effect: Peck deals damage with no additional effect, besides being able to hit non-adjacent Pokémon in triple battles.

name: Perish Song
description: Any Pokémon that hears this song faints in three turns, unless it switches out of battle.
effect: Any Pokémon in play when this attack is used faints in 3 turns.

name: Petal Blizzard
description: The user stirs up a violent petal blizzard and attacks everything around it.
effect: Petal Blizzard deals damage with no additional effect. In double battles it will hit all Pokémon on the field; in triple battles it will hit all adjacent Pokémon.

name: Petal Dance
description: The user attacks the target by scattering petals for two to three turns. The user then becomes confused.
effect: The user of Petal Dance attacks for 2-3 turns, during which it cannot switch out, and then becomes confused. Confused Pokémon have a 33% chance of hurting themselves each turn, for 1-4 attacking turns (50% chance in Generations 1-6). The damage received is as if the Pokémon attacks itself with a typeless 40 base power Physical attack. If Petal Dance is disrupted (e.g. if the move misses or the user cannot attack due to paralysis) then it will stop and not cause confusion. Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused.

name: Phantom Force
description: The user vanishes somewhere, then strikes the target on the next turn. This move hits even if the target protects itself.
effect: Phantom Force causes the user to disappear on the first turn, becoming invulnerable to most attacks. On the second turn, it deals damage and can hit Pokémon using Protect or Detect.

name: Photon Geyser
description: The user attacks a target with a pillar of light. This move inflicts Attack or Sp. Atk damage—whichever stat is higher for the user.
effect: Photon Geyser deals damage, but uses either the user's Attack or Special Attack stat to determine its power, whichever is higher.

name: Pika Papow
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Pika Papow is a Pikachu-exclusive Partner Power from Pokémon Let's Go. The power increases when Pikachu's Friendship is higher (similar to Return), up to a maximum base power of 102. When a different Pokémon is in battle, Pika Papow may be used to boost that Pokémon's stats.

name: Pin Missile
description: Sharp spikes are shot at the target in rapid succession. They hit two to five times in a row.

name: Plasma Fists
description: The user attacks with electrically charged fists. This move changes Normal-type moves to Electric-type moves.
effect: Changes Normal-type moves to Electric-type moves.

name: Play Nice
description: The user and the target become friends, and the target loses its will to fight. This lowers the target’s Attack stat.
effect: Play Nice lowers the target's Attack by one stage. The move always hits, even if the target used a Protect-like move. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Play Rough
description: The user plays rough with the target and attacks it. This may also lower the target’s Attack stat.
effect: Play Rough deals damage and has a 10% chance of lowering the target's Attack by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Pluck
description: The user pecks the target. If the target is holding a Berry, the user eats it and gains its effect.
effect: If the opponent is holding a berry, its effect is stolen by user.

name: Poison Fang
description: The user bites the target with toxic fangs. This may also leave the target badly poisoned.
effect: Poison Fang deals damage and has a 50% chance of badly poisoning the target. Badly poisoned Pokémon will lose an increasing amount of HP at the end of each turn.

name: Poison Gas
description: A cloud of poison gas is sprayed in the face of opposing Pokémon, poisoning those it hits.
effect: Poison Gas causes the target to become poisoned. Poisoned Pokémon lose 1⁄8 of their maximum HP each turn. Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned.

name: Poison Jab
description: The target is stabbed with a tentacle, arm, or the like steeped in poison. This may also poison the target.
effect: Poison Jab deals damage and has a 30% chance of poisoning the target. Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned.

name: Poison Powder
description: The user scatters a cloud of poisonous dust that poisons the target.
effect: Poison Powder causes the target to become poisoned. Poisoned Pokémon lose 1⁄8 of their maximum HP each turn. Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned.

name: Poison Sting
description: The user stabs the target with a poisonous stinger. This may also poison the target.
effect: Poison Sting deals damage and has a 30% chance of poisoning the target. Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned.

name: Poison Tail
description: The user hits the target with its tail. This may also poison the target. Critical hits land more easily.
effect: Poison Tail deals damage and has a 10% chance of poisoning the target. It also has an increased critical hit ratio (1⁄8 instead of 1⁄16). Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned.

name: Pollen Puff
description: The user attacks the enemy with a pollen puff that explodes. If the target is an ally, it gives the ally a pollen puff that restores its HP instead.
effect: Deals damage to opponent or restores HP of teammate.

name: Pound
description: The target is physically pounded with a long tail, a foreleg, or the like.
effect: Pound deals damage with no additional effect.

name: Powder
description: The user covers the target in a combustible powder. If the target uses a Fire-type move, the powder explodes and damages the target.
effect: Powder moves with priority and covers the target in a powder that lasts for the rest of the current turn only. It damages the target if they use a Fire type move in that turn, and prevents the Fire move from working.

name: Powder Snow
description: The user attacks with a chilling gust of powdery snow. This may also freeze opposing Pokémon.
effect: Powder Snow deals damage and has a 10% chance of freezing the target. Ice type Pokémon, those with the ability Magma Armor or those behind a Substitute cannot be frozen.

name: Power Gem
description: The user attacks with a ray of light that sparkles as if it were made of gemstones.
effect: Power Gem deals damage with no additional effect.

name: Power Split
description: The user employs its psychic power to average its Attack and Sp. Atk stats with those of the target.
effect: Power Split averages the user's Attack and Special Attack with those of the target. Stat boosts are not taken into account. The effect lasts until the battle ends or the Pokémon switches out. For example, if the user's Attack was 100, the opponent's was 200, and the opponent had used Swords Dance, then both Pokémon would end up with 150 Attack. Due to the stat boost, the opponent's effective Attack would now be 300 (instead of the 400 it was originally).

name: Power Swap
description: The user employs its psychic power to switch changes to its Attack and Sp. Atk stats with the target.
effect: User and opponent swap Attack and Special Attack.

name: Power Trick
description: The user employs its psychic power to switch its Attack stat with its Defense stat.
effect: User's own Attack and Defense switch.

name: Power Trip
description: The user boasts its strength and attacks the target. The more the user’s stats are raised, the greater the move’s power.
effect: The user boasts its strength and attacks the target. The more the user's stats are raised, the greater the move's power.

name: Power Whip
description: The user violently whirls its vines, tentacles, or the like to harshly lash the target.
effect: Power Whip deals damage with no additional effect.

name: Power-Up Punch
description: Striking opponents over and over makes the user’s fists harder. Hitting a target raises the Attack stat.
effect: Power-Up Punch deals damage and raises the user's Attack by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Precipice Blades
description: The user attacks opposing Pokémon by manifesting the power of the land in fearsome blades of stone.
effect: Precipice Blades deals damage and hits all adjacent opponents in double/triple battles. It is the signature move of Groudon.

name: Present
description: The user attacks by giving the target a gift with a hidden trap. It restores HP sometimes, however.
effect: Either deals damage or heals.

name: Prismatic Laser
description: The user shoots powerful lasers using the power of a prism. The user can’t move on the next turn.
effect: The user shoots powerful lasers using the power of a prism. The user can't move on the next turn.

name: Protect
description: This move enables the user to protect itself from all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used in succession.
effect: Protect prevents any attacks targeted at the user from striking, for the duration of the turn. It has priority +4 so will activate before most other moves. The move functions identically to Detect. The accuracy of Protect decreases by 1⁄3 each time it is used consecutively after itself or Detect, Endure, Wide Guard, Quick Guard, Spiky Shield, King's Shield, or Baneful Bunker. Damage-dealing Z-Moves bypass Protect but deal 1⁄4 of the damage.

name: Psybeam
description: The target is attacked with a peculiar ray. This may also leave the target confused.
effect: Psybeam deals damage and has a 10% chance of confusing the target. Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused.

name: Psych Up
description: The user hypnotizes itself into copying any stat change made by the target.
effect: Copies the opponent's stat changes.

name: Psychic
description: The target is hit by a strong telekinetic force. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.
effect: Psychic deals damage and has a 10% chance of lowering the target's Special Defense by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Psychic Fangs
description: The user bites the target with its psychic capabilities. This can also destroy Light Screen and Reflect.
effect: The user bites the target with its psychic capabilities. This can also destroy Light Screen and Reflect.

name: Psychic Terrain
description: This protects Pokémon on the ground from priority moves and powers up Psychic-type moves for five turns.
effect: Psychic Terrain creates a low-lying psychic field lasting 5 turns, that prevents grounded Pokémon from being hit by high-priority moves (such as Quick Attack or Sucker Punch). The power of Psychic type moves also increases while in effect. Grounded Pokémon are simply those that are not raised. Raised Pokémon are any Flying types or those under the effects of Levitate, Magnet Rise or Telekinesis. Full details in glossary. Psychic Terrain is a terrain condition and can coexist at the same time as weather conditions, but not other terrain conditions. The move Nature Power turns into Psychic under Psychic Terrain.

name: Psycho Boost
description: The user attacks the target at full power. The attack’s recoil harshly lowers the user’s Sp. Atk stat.
effect: Psycho Boost deals damage but lowers the user's Special Attack by two stages after attacking. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Psycho Cut
description: The user tears at the target with blades formed by psychic power. Critical hits land more easily.
effect: Psycho Cut deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio (1⁄8 instead of 1⁄16).

name: Psycho Shift
description: Using its psychic power of suggestion, the user transfers its status conditions to the target.
effect: Gives the opponent the user's status condition, if it hits.

name: Psyshock
description: The user materializes an odd psychic wave to attack the target. This attack does physical damage.
effect: Inflicts damage based on the target's Defense, not Special Defense.

name: Psystrike
description: The user materializes an odd psychic wave to attack the target. This attack does physical damage.
effect: Inflicts damage based on the target's Defense, not Special Defense.

name: Psywave
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Psywave inflicts a random amount of HP damage, varying between 50% and 150% of the user's level. In other words, at level 100 the damage will be 50-150 HP. The damage is typeless (not affected by type advantages/disadvantages) but it still does not affect Dark type Pokémon.

name: Pulverizing Pancake
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Pulverizing Pancake is a Normal type Z-Move exclusive to Snorlax. It is used with Giga Impact.

name: Punishment
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Punishment deals varying damage based on the opponent's stat increases. It starts at base power 60 and increases by 20 for every net stat boost of the opponent, up to a maximum of 200 (7 boosts). In other words the power is:

name: Purify
description: The user heals the target’s status condition. If the move succeeds, it also restores the user’s own HP.
effect: The user heals the target's status condition. If the move succeeds, it also restores the user's own HP.

name: Pursuit
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Pursuit deals damage, and hits with double power if the target is switching out. In that case, Pursuit technically has priority +7, meaning it attacks before all other actions and moves.

name: Pyro Ball
description: The user attacks by igniting a small stone and launching it as a fiery ball at the target. This may also leave the target with a burn.
effect: May burn opponent.

name: Quash
description: The user suppresses the target and makes its move go last.
effect: Quash forces the target Pokémon to move last in the current turn. It does not have priority so will fail if the target already moved in the current turn. Therefore it is useless in single battles and only works in double/triple battles.

name: Quick Attack
description: The user lunges at the target at a speed that makes it almost invisible. This move always goes first.
effect: Quick Attack deals damage and has a priority of +1. Moves with a higher priority always go first, regardless of a Pokémon's speed. If two moves with the same priority are used, the faster Pokémon goes first as usual.

name: Quick Guard
description: The user protects itself and its allies from priority moves.
effect: Quick Guard protects the user's team from all increased priority moves (such as Extreme Speed or Bullet Punch), for the duration of the turn. It has priority +3 so will activate before most other moves. The accuracy of Quick Guard does not decrease if used consecutively after itself or Wide Guard. However, it does decrease the accuracy of Protect, Detect, Endure, Spiky Shield, King's Shield and Baneful Bunker by 1⁄3 each time it or Wide Guard is used.

name: Quiver Dance
description: The user lightly performs a beautiful, mystic dance. This boosts the user’s Sp. Atk, Sp. Def, and Speed stats.
effect: Quiver Dance raises the user's Special Attack, Special Defense and Speed by one stage each. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Rage
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Rage deals damage, and if the user is hit by a direct attack - any time after Rage is first used but before a different move is used - the user's Attack is raised by one stage. The game will state the Pokémon's rage is building rather than explicitly assert the stat increase. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. The Attack increases will continue as long as Rage is the last move used, even if it misses, the user is incapacitated (paralyzed, sleeping, etc) or the player uses an item. The Attack increase activates for every blow of multi-hit moves such as DoubleSlap or Fury Swipes. As an example, if a Pokémon uses Rage then the opponent hits the user in the same turn, the user's Attack increases. If the user moves last it will not increase that turn, but will in the next turn if the opponent hits the user again.

name: Rage Powder
description: The user scatters a cloud of irritating powder to draw attention to itself. Opposing Pokémon aim only at the user.
effect: Rage Powder redirects all single-target moves used by opponents to itself. It is only useful in double or triple battles. It does not work for moves that target multiple Pokémon such as Air Cutter or Bulldoze.

name: Rain Dance
description: The user summons a heavy rain that falls for five turns, powering up Water-type moves. It lowers the power of Fire-type moves.
effect: Rain Dance causes a rain shower that lasts for 5 turns, and induces these additional effects:

name: Rapid Spin
description: A spin attack that can also eliminate such moves as Bind, Wrap, and Leech Seed. This also raises the user’s Speed stat.
effect: Rapid Spin deals a small amount of damage and removes the effects of several trap moves. It fails if the move misses or the target is immune. The effects from the following moves are removed:

name: Razor Leaf
description: Sharp-edged leaves are launched to slash at opposing Pokémon. Critical hits land more easily.
effect: Razor Leaf deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio (1⁄8 instead of 1⁄16).

name: Razor Shell
description: The user cuts its target with sharp shells. This may also lower the target’s Defense stat.
effect: Razor Shell deals damage and has a 50% chance of lowering the target's Defense by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Razor Wind
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: The user of Razor Wind will whip up a whirlwind on the first turn. On the second turn, Razor Wind deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio (1⁄8 instead of 1⁄16). If the user is holding a Power Herb, Razor Wind executes in one turn.

name: Recover
description: Restoring its own cells, the user restores its own HP by half of its max HP.
effect: Recover restores up to 50% of the user's maximum HP.

name: Recycle
description: The user recycles a held item that has been used in battle so it can be used again.
effect: User's used hold item is restored.

name: Reflect
description: A wondrous wall of light is put up to reduce damage from physical attacks for five turns.
effect: Reflect reduces damage from Physical attacks by 50%, for 5 turns. Its effects apply to all Pokémon on the user's side of the field. If the user is holding Light Clay when Reflect is used, its effects last for 8 turns. The move Brick Break, when used against an Pokémon under Reflect's effect, will remove the screen before dealing damage. The ability Infiltrator bypasses the effects of Reflect. Reflect is the Physical counterpart to Light Screen.

name: Reflect Type
description: The user reflects the target’s type, making the user the same type as the target.
effect: Reflect Type changes the user's type to match the type(s) of the target.

name: Refresh
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Cures paralysis, poison, and burns.

name: Relic Song
description: The user sings an ancient song and attacks by appealing to the hearts of the listening opposing Pokémon. This may also induce sleep.
effect: May put the target to sleep. (10% chance)

name: Rest
description: The user goes to sleep for two turns. This fully restores the user’s HP and heals any status conditions.
effect: User sleeps for 2 turns, but user is fully healed.

name: Retaliate
description: The user gets revenge for a fainted ally. If an ally fainted in the previous turn, this move’s power is increased.
effect: Inflicts double damage if a teammate fainted on the last turn.

name: Return
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: The power of Return is higher when the user likes its trainer more. The base power varies between 1 (minimum Friendship) and 102 (maximum Friendship). The exact formula is:

name: Revelation Dance
description: The user attacks the target by dancing very hard. The user’s type determines the type of this move.
effect: Revelation Dance deals damage with a different type depending on the style of Oricorio:

name: Revenge
description: This attack move’s power is doubled if the user has been hurt by the opponent in the same turn.
effect: Power increases if user was hit first.

name: Reversal
description: An all-out attack that becomes more powerful the less HP the user has.
effect: Reversal deals more damage the lower the user's HP is, as per the table below.

name: Roar
description: The target is scared off, and a different Pokémon is dragged out. In the wild, this ends a battle against a single Pokémon.
effect: In the wild, Roar causes the target Pokémon to flee if they are of a lower level, and the battle ends. In trainer battles (including linked battles), Roar forces the target to switch out of battle (regardless of level) and is replaced with another Pokémon in the trainer's team.  Pokémon with the abilities Soundproof or Suction Cups or those rooted by Ingrain are not affected by Roar.

name: Roar of Time
description: The user blasts the target with power that distorts even time. The user can’t move on the next turn.
effect: User must recharge next turn.

name: Rock Blast
description: The user hurls hard rocks at the target. Two to five rocks are launched in a row.

name: Rock Climb
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Rock Climb deals damage and has a 20% chance of confusing the target. Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused.

name: Rock Polish
description: The user polishes its body to reduce drag. This sharply raises the Speed stat.
effect: Rock Polish raises the user's Speed by two stages. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Rock Slide
description: Large boulders are hurled at opposing Pokémon to inflict damage. This may also make the opposing Pokémon flinch.
effect: Rock Slide deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved). Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.

name: Rock Smash
description: The user attacks with a punch. This may also lower the target’s Defense stat.
effect: Rock Smash deals damage and has a 50% chance of lowering the target's Defense by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Rock Throw
description: The user picks up and throws a small rock at the target to attack.
effect: Rock Throw deals damage with no additional effect.

name: Rock Tomb
description: Boulders are hurled at the target. This also lowers the target’s Speed stat by preventing its movement.
effect: Rock Tomb deals damage and lowers the target's Speed by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Rock Wrecker
description: The user launches a huge boulder at the target to attack. The user can’t move on the next turn.
effect: User must recharge next turn.

name: Role Play
description: The user mimics the target completely, copying the target’s Ability.
effect: Role Play copies the opponent's ability, replacing its own with that of the target's. Role Play does not work on Pokémon with Wonder Guard or Multitype.

name: Rolling Kick
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Rolling Kick deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved). Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.

name: Rollout
description: The user continually rolls into the target over five turns. It becomes more powerful each time it hits.
effect: Rollout deals damage for 5 turns, doubling in power each turn. The move stops if it misses on any turn. If it doesn't miss, Rollout will deal 30, 60, 120, 240 and 480 base power damage each turn respectively. If the user has used Defense Curl in any previous turn (without switching out) then Rollout doubles in power, i.e. it will deal 60, 120, 240, 480 and 960 base power damage respectively. As Rollout has 90% accuracy, the chances of it being successful for each turn (with normal Accuracy/Evasion and no other interruptions) are 90%, 81%, 73%, 66% and 59% respectively. In other words, roughly 3 out of every 5 times Rollout is used, it will hit for the full 5 turns.

name: Roost
description: The user lands and rests its body. This move restores the user’s HP by up to half of its max HP.
effect: User recovers half of its max HP and loses the Flying type temporarily.

name: Rototiller
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Rototiller raises the Attack and Special Attack of any Grass-type Pokémon on the field by one stage each. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Round
description: The user attacks the target with a song. Others can join in the Round to increase the power of the attack.
effect: Round deals damage. If multiple Pokémon on the same team use it in the same turn, the power doubles to 120 and the slower Pokémon move immediately after the fastest Pokémon uses it, regardless of their Speed.

name: Sacred Fire
description: The target is razed with a mystical fire of great intensity. This may also leave the target with a burn.
effect: Sacred Fire deals damage and has a 50% chance of burning the target. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned. If the user is frozen, Sacred Fire can be used and will thaw out the Pokémon before attacking.

name: Sacred Sword
description: The user attacks by slicing with a long horn. The target’s stat changes don’t affect this attack’s damage.
effect: Sacred Sword deals damage, but ignores changes to the target's stats (i.e. Defense and Evasion in this case). Note this does not include the effects of screens like Reflect as they are different to regular stat boosts.

name: Safeguard
description: The user creates a protective field that prevents status conditions for five turns.
effect: The user's party is protected from status conditions.

name: Sand Attack
description: Sand is hurled in the target’s face, reducing the target’s accuracy.
effect: Sand Attack lowers the target's Accuracy by one stage. Although it is a Ground-type move it still affects raised Pokémon. Raised Pokémon are any Flying types or those under the effects of Levitate, Magnet Rise or Telekinesis. Full details in glossary. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. Pokémon with the abilities Keen Eye, Clear Body or White Smoke cannot have their accuracy reduced.

name: Sand Tomb
description: The user traps the target inside a harshly raging sandstorm for four to five turns.
effect: Sand Tomb inflicts damage on the first turn then traps the opponent, causing them to lose 1⁄8 of their maximum HP after each turn, for 4-5 turns. If the user holds a Grip Claw, the after-effects last for 7 turns. If a Binding Band is held, the damage is 1⁄6 of the target's maximum HP.

name: Sandstorm
description: A five-turn sandstorm is summoned to hurt all combatants except Rock, Ground, and Steel types. It raises the Sp. Def stat of Rock types.
effect: Sandstorm creates a sandstorm on the battlefield that lasts for 5 turns and induces these additional effects:

name: Sappy Seed
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Sappy Seed deals damage and plants a seed on the target that drains 1⁄8 of its maximum HP at the end of each turn (similar to Leech Seed). Sappy Seed is an Eevee-exclusive tutor move from Pokémon Let's Go, along with Bouncy Bubble, Buzzy Buzz, Sizzly Slide, Glitzy Glow, Baddy Bad, Freezy Frost, and Sparkly Swirl.

name: Savage Spin-Out
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Savage Spin-Out is the Bug type Z-Move, introduced in Pokémon Sun/Moon.

name: Scald
description: The user shoots boiling hot water at its target. This may also leave the target with a burn.
effect: Scald deals damage and has a 30% chance of burning the target. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned. If the user is frozen, Scald can be used and will thaw out the Pokémon before attacking.

name: Scary Face
description: The user frightens the target with a scary face to harshly lower its Speed stat.
effect: Scary Face lowers the target's Speed by two stages. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Scratch
description: Hard, pointed, sharp claws rake the target to inflict damage.
effect: Scratch is one of the most common and basic moves a Pokémon learns. It deals damage with no additional effects.

name: Screech
description: An earsplitting screech harshly lowers the target’s Defense stat.
effect: Screech lowers the target's Defense by two stages. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Searing Shot
description: The user torches everything around it in an inferno of scarlet flames. This may also leave those it hits with a burn.
effect: Searing Shot deals damage and has a 30% chance of burning the target. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned.

name: Searing Sunraze Smash
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Searing Sunraze Smash is a Steel type Z-Move exclusive to Solgaleo and Dusk Mane Necrozma, introduced in Pokémon Ultra Sun & Ultra Moon. It is used with Solgaleo's signature move, Sunsteel Strike. Searing Sunraze Smash deals damage, ignoring the target's ability.

name: Secret Power
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Secret Power deals damage and has a 30% chance of inducing a secondary effect on the opponent, depending on the environment. The move's animation also changes, reusing that of a specific attack for each terrain.

name: Secret Sword
description: The user cuts with its long horn. The odd power contained in the horn does physical damage to the target.
effect: Inflicts damage based on the target's Defense, not Special Defense.

name: Seed Bomb
description: The user slams a barrage of hard-shelled seeds down on the target from above.
effect: Seed Bomb deals damage with no additional effect.

name: Seed Flare
description: The user emits a shock wave from its body to attack its target. This may also harshly lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.
effect: Seed Flare deals damage and has a 40% chance of lowering the target's Special Defense by two stages. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Seismic Toss
description: The target is thrown using the power of gravity. It inflicts damage equal to the user’s level.
effect: The damage of Seismic Toss is equal to the user's level. So at level 100 the Pokémon will inflict 100 HP damage.

name: Self-Destruct
description: The user attacks everything around it by causing an explosion. The user faints upon using this move.
effect: Self-Destruct deals high damage, but causes the user to faint.

name: Shadow Ball
description: The user hurls a shadowy blob at the target. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.
effect: Shadow Ball deals damage and has a 20% chance of lowering the target's Special Defense by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Shadow Bone
description: The user attacks by beating the target with a bone that contains a spirit. This may also lower the target’s Defense stat.
effect: The user attacks by beating the target with a bone that contains a spirit. This may also lower the target's Defense stat.

name: Shadow Claw
description: The user slashes with a sharp claw made from shadows. Critical hits land more easily.
effect: Shadow Claw deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio (1⁄8 instead of 1⁄16).

name: Shadow Force
description: The user disappears, then strikes the target on the next turn. This move hits even if the target protects itself.
effect: The user of Shadow Force will vanish instantly on the first turn, disappearing from view and becoming invulnerable to most attacks. On the second turn, Shadow Force deals damage and can hit Pokémon using Protect or Detect. It also removes their effect for the rest of the turn (in double and triple battles). While disappeared, the Pokémon can only be hit by moves from No Guard Pokémon, or any move following an identify move. If the user is holding a Power Herb, Shadow Force executes in one turn.

name: Shadow Punch
description: The user throws a punch from the shadows. This attack never misses.
effect: Shadow Punch deals damage and ignores changes to the Accuracy and Evasion stats. However, it will not hit Pokémon during the invulnerable stage of Bounce, Dig, Dive, Fly, Shadow Force or Sky Drop.

name: Shadow Sneak
description: The user extends its shadow and attacks the target from behind. This move always goes first.
effect: Shadow Sneak deals damage and has a priority of +1. Moves with a higher priority always go first, regardless of a Pokémon's speed. If two moves with the same priority are used, the faster Pokémon goes first as usual.

name: Sharpen
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Sharpen raises the user's Attack by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Shattered Psyche
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Shattered Psyche is the Psychic type Z-Move, introduced in Pokémon Sun/Moon.

name: Sheer Cold
description: The target faints instantly. It’s less likely to hit the target if it’s used by Pokémon other than Ice types.
effect: If it hits, Sheer Cold is guaranteed to make the opponent faint. It is more likely to hit Pokémon that are of a lower level than the user. Its accuracy (as a percentage) is calculated as below, ignoring all other accuracy and evasion modifiers:

name: Shell Smash
description: The user breaks its shell, which lowers Defense and Sp. Def stats but sharply raises its Attack, Sp. Atk, and Speed stats.
effect: Shell Smash lowers the user's Defense and Special Defense by one stage each, while also raising Attack, Special Attack and Speed by two stages each. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each, or lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Shell Trap
description: The user sets a shell trap. If the user is hit by a physical move, the trap will explode and inflict damage on opposing Pokémon.
effect: Shell Trap sets a trap at the beginning of the turn, and if the user is hit by a physical move during the turn, it deals high damage to the opponent.

name: Shift Gear
description: The user rotates its gears, raising its Attack stat and sharply raising its Speed stat.
effect: Shift Gear raises the user's Attack by one stage and Speed by two stages. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Shock Wave
description: The user strikes the target with a quick jolt of electricity. This attack never misses.
effect: Shock Wave deals damage and ignores changes to the Accuracy and Evasion stats. However, it will not hit Pokémon during the invulnerable stage of Bounce, Dig, Dive, Fly, Shadow Force or Sky Drop.

name: Shore Up
description: The user regains up to half of its max HP. It restores more HP in a sandstorm.
effect: The user regains up to half of its max HP. It restores more HP in a sandstorm.

name: Signal Beam
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Signal Beam deals damage and has a 10% chance of confusing the target. Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused.

name: Silver Wind
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Silver Wind deals damage and has a 10% chance of raising the user's Attack, Defense, Special Attack, Special Defense and Speed by one stage each. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Simple Beam
description: The user’s mysterious psychic wave changes the target’s Ability to Simple.
effect: Simple Beam changes the target's ability to Simple. It does not cancel any ability's effects already felt (such as the Attack drop from Intimidate), but it does stop any further effects the ability may have (for example, damage from Rough Skin). It does not work on Pokémon with the abilities Truant or Multitype.

name: Sing
description: A soothing lullaby is sung in a calming voice that puts the target into a deep slumber.
effect: Sing puts the target to sleep, if it hits. Sleeping Pokémon cannot move (with some exceptions such as Snore). Sleep lasts for 1-3 turns. Pokémon with the abilities Insomnia or Vital Spirit, or those behind a Substitute cannot be put to sleep.

name: Sinister Arrow Raid
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Sinister Arrow Raid is a Ghost type Z-move exclusive to Decidueye. It is used with Decidueye's signature move Spirit Shackle.

name: Sizzly Slide
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Sizzly Slide deals damage and burns the opponent. Sizzly Slide is an Eevee-exclusive tutor move from Pokémon Let's Go, along with Bouncy Bubble, Buzzy Buzz, Glitzy Glow, Baddy Bad, Sappy Seed, Freezy Frost, and Sparkly Swirl.

name: Sketch
description: It enables the user to permanently learn the move last used by the target. Once used, Sketch disappears.
effect: Permanently copies the opponent's last move.

name: Skill Swap
description: The user employs its psychic power to exchange Abilities with the target.
effect: The user swaps Abilities with the opponent.

name: Skull Bash
description: The user tucks in its head to raise its Defense stat on the first turn, then rams the target on the next turn.
effect: The user of Skull Bash will tuck in its head on the first turn and raise its Defense by one stage. On the second turn, Skull Bash deals damage. If the user is holding a Power Herb, Skull Bash executes in one turn.

name: Sky Attack
description: A second-turn attack move where critical hits land more easily. This may also make the target flinch.
effect: The user of Sky Attack will become cloaked in a harsh light on the first turn. On the second turn, Sky Attack deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved). Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch. If the user is holding a Power Herb, Sky Attack executes in one turn.

name: Sky Drop
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Sky Drop takes the target into the air on the first turn, then drops them on the second turn, wherein they receive damage. While in the air, neither Pokémon can be hit, except by Gust, Hurricane, Sky Uppercut, Smack Down, Thunder or Twister. Moves from No Guard Pokémon, or any move following an identify move can also hit. Sky Drop will appear to work on Flying-types and those under the effects of Levitate, Magnet Rise or Telekinesis, but will not cause them any damage. It fails if Gravity is in effect, the target is holding an Iron Ball, or is behind a Substitute. There is a glitch with Sky Drop in Black/White in double battles. If Gravity is put into effect while the Pokémon are in the air, the user of Sky Drop returns to the ground, but the target stays in the air and cannot attack or be hit (besides the moves noted above). Due to this, it was briefly banned from Wi-Fi battles and all official Pokémon competitions.

name: Sky Uppercut
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Hits the opponent, even during Fly.

name: Slack Off
description: The user slacks off, restoring its own HP by up to half of its max HP.
effect: Slack Off recovers up to 50% of the user's maximum HP.

name: Slam
description: The target is slammed with a long tail, vines, or the like to inflict damage.
effect: Slam deals damage with no additional effect.

name: Slash
description: The target is attacked with a slash of claws or blades. Critical hits land more easily.
effect: Slash deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio (1⁄8 instead of 1⁄16).

name: Sleep Powder
description: The user scatters a big cloud of sleep-inducing dust around the target.
effect: Sleep Powder puts the target to sleep, if it hits. Sleeping Pokémon cannot move (with some exceptions such as Snore). Sleep lasts for 1-3 turns. Pokémon with the abilities Insomnia or Vital Spirit, or those behind a Substitute cannot be put to sleep.

name: Sleep Talk
description: While it is asleep, the user randomly uses one of the moves it knows.
effect: User performs one of its own moves while sleeping.

name: Sludge
description: Unsanitary sludge is hurled at the target. This may also poison the target.
effect: Sludge deals damage and has a 30% chance of poisoning the target. Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned.

name: Sludge Bomb
description: Unsanitary sludge is hurled at the target. This may also poison the target.
effect: Sludge Bomb deals damage and has a 30% chance of poisoning the target. Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned.

name: Sludge Wave
description: The user strikes everything around it by swamping the area with a giant sludge wave. This may also poison those hit.
effect: Sludge Wave deals damage and has a 10% chance of poisoning the target. Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned.

name: Smack Down
description: The user throws a stone or similar projectile to attack the target. A flying Pokémon will fall to the ground when it’s hit.
effect: Smack Down deals damage and knocks the target to the ground. Any raised Pokémon now become susceptible to Ground moves and Arena Trap. Raised Pokémon are any Flying types or those under the effects of Levitate, Magnet Rise or Telekinesis. Full details in glossary. Smack Down can hit Pokémon using Fly or Bounce and will bring them back down to the ground, thus cancelling the moves. It can also hit Pokémon using Sky Drop but does not knock them to the ground. It does not knock down Substitutes but deals damage to the Substitute as normal.

name: Smart Strike
description: The user stabs the target with a sharp horn. This attack never misses.
effect: The user stabs the target with a sharp horn. This attack never misses.

name: Smelling Salts
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Smelling Salts deals damage, and hits with double power (140) if the target is paralyzed. However, it also cures the paralysis.

name: Smog
description: The target is attacked with a discharge of filthy gases. This may also poison the target.
effect: Smog deals damage and has a 40% chance of poisoning the target. Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned.

name: Smokescreen
description: The user releases an obscuring cloud of smoke or ink. This lowers the target’s accuracy.
effect: Smokescreen lowers the target's Accuracy by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. Pokémon with the abilities Keen Eye, Clear Body or White Smoke cannot have their accuracy reduced.

name: Snap Trap
description: The user snares the target in a snap trap for four to five turns.
effect: Snares the target in a snap trap for four to five turns.

name: Snarl
description: The user yells as if it’s ranting about something, which lowers the Sp. Atk stats of opposing Pokémon.
effect: Snarl deals damage and lowers the target's Special Attack by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Snatch
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Snatch moves first and steals the effects of the next status move used by the opponent(s) in that turn. If two or more Pokémon use Snatch, the slowest of the Pokémon will gain the effect, because the fastest Pokémon will steal the move first, then the next slowest will steal the move from the snatcher and so on. Moves that can be snatched:

name: Snipe Shot
description: The user ignores the effects of opposing Pokémon’s moves and Abilities that draw in moves, allowing this move to hit the chosen target.
effect: Ignores moves and abilities that draw in moves.

name: Snore
description: This attack can be used only if the user is asleep. The harsh noise may also make the target flinch.
effect: Snore deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved). However, it can only be used while the user is asleep (either from a move like Hypnosis or self-induced via Rest). Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.

name: Soak
description: The user shoots a torrent of water at the target and changes the target’s type to Water.
effect: Soak changes the target's type to Water. It does not work on Pokémon with the ability Multitype.

name: Soft-Boiled
description: The user restores its own HP by up to half of its max HP.
effect: Soft-Boiled recovers up to 50% of the user's maximum HP.

name: Solar Beam
description: In this two-turn attack, the user gathers light, then blasts a bundled beam on the next turn.
effect: The user of Solar Beam will absorb light on the first turn. On the second turn, Solar Beam deals damage. During intense sunlight or when holding a Power Herb, Solar Beam executes in one turn. During rain, hail or a sandstorm its power decreases by 50%.

name: Solar Blade
description: In this two-turn attack, the user gathers light and fills a blade with the light’s energy, attacking the target on the next turn.
effect: The user of Solar Blade will absorb light on the first turn. On the second turn, Solar Blade deals damage. During intense sunlight or when holding a Power Herb, Solar Blade executes in one turn. During rain, hail or a sandstorm its power decreases by 50%.

name: Sonic Boom
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Sonic Boom always deals 20 HP damage to the target, regardless of typing (although Ghost type Pokémon are still immune). It has no additional effect.

name: Soul-Stealing 7-Star Strike
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Soul-Stealing 7-Star Strike is a Ghost type Z-move exclusive to Marshadow. It is used with Marshadow's signature move Spectral Thief.

name: Spacial Rend
description: The user tears the target along with the space around it. Critical hits land more easily.
effect: Spacial Rend deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio (1⁄8 instead of 1⁄16).

name: Spark
description: The user throws an electrically charged tackle at the target. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
effect: Spark deals damage and has a 30% chance of paralyzing the target. Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.

name: Sparkling Aria
description: The user bursts into song, emitting many bubbles. Any Pokémon suffering from a burn will be healed by the touch of these bubbles.
effect: Sparkling Aria deals damage, and if the target is burned, heals it.

name: Sparkly Swirl
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Sparkly Swirl deals damage and heals all status conditions of the user's party Pokémon (similar to Aromatherapy). Sparkly Swirl is an Eevee-exclusive tutor move from Pokémon Let's Go, along with Bouncy Bubble, Buzzy Buzz, Sizzly Slide, Glitzy Glow, Baddy Bad, Sappy Seed, and Freezy Frost.

name: Spectral Thief
description: The user hides in the target’s shadow, steals the target’s stat boosts, and then attacks.
effect: The user hides in the target's shadow, steals the target's stat boosts, and then attacks.

name: Speed Swap
description: The user exchanges Speed stats with the target.
effect: The user exchanges Speed stats with the target.

name: Spider Web
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Opponent cannot escape/switch.

name: Spike Cannon
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.

name: Spikes
description: The user lays a trap of spikes at the opposing team’s feet. The trap hurts Pokémon that switch into battle.

name: Spiky Shield
description: In addition to protecting the user from attacks, this move also damages any attacker that makes direct contact.
effect: Spiky Shield prevents any attacks targeted at the user from striking, for the duration of the turn. If a contact move is targeted at the Spiky Shield user on that turn, the attacker receives damage of 1⁄8 their maximum HP. It has priority +4 so will activate before most other moves. Contact damage does not stack with the Rocky Helmet item or the Rough Skin or Iron Barbs abilities. The accuracy of Spiky Shield drops by 1⁄3 each time it is used consecutively after itself or Protect, Detect, Endure, Wide Guard, Quick Guard, King's Shield, or Baneful Bunker.

name: Spirit Break
description: The user attacks the target with so much force that it could break the target’s spirit. This also lowers the target’s Sp. Atk stat.
effect: Spirit Break deals damage and lowers the target's Special Attack by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Spirit Shackle
description: The user attacks while simultaneously stitching the target’s shadow to the ground to prevent the target from escaping.
effect: Spirit Shackle deals damage and prevents the target from switching out, while the user remains in battle.

name: Spit Up
description: The power stored using the move Stockpile is released at once in an attack. The more power is stored, the greater the move’s power.
effect: Spit Up deals varying damage depending on how many times the user used Stockpile. The base power is 100, 200 or 300 if the user stockpiled one, two or three times respectively. Spit Up also removes the Defense and Special Defense boosts given through Stockpile.

name: Spite
description: The user unleashes its grudge on the move last used by the target by cutting 4 PP from it.
effect: The opponent's last move loses 2-5 PP.

name: Splash
description: The user just flops and splashes around to no effect at all...
effect: Doesn't do ANYTHING.

name: Splintered Stormshards
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Splintered Stormshards is a Rock-type Z-Move exclusive to Lycanroc. It is used with Stone Edge. Splintered Stormshards deals damage and eliminates Terrain effects (i.e. Electric Terrain, Grassy Terrain, Misty Terrain or Psychic Terrain).

name: Splishy Splash
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Splishy Splash deals damage and has a 30% chance to paralyze the target. Splishy Splash is a Pikachu-exclusive tutor move from Pokémon Let's Go, along with Zippy Zap and Floaty Fall.

name: Spore
description: The user scatters bursts of spores that induce sleep.
effect: Spore puts the target to sleep. Sleeping Pokémon cannot move (with some exceptions such as Snore). Sleep lasts for 1-3 turns. Pokémon with the abilities Insomnia or Vital Spirit, or those behind a Substitute cannot be put to sleep.

name: Spotlight
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: The user shines a spotlight on the target so that only the target will be attacked during the turn.

name: Stealth Rock
description: The user lays a trap of levitating stones around the opposing team. The trap hurts opposing Pokémon that switch into battle.

name: Steam Eruption
description: The user immerses the target in superheated steam. This may also leave the target with a burn.
effect: Steam Eruption deals damage and has a 30% chance of burning the target. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned.

name: Steamroller
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Steamroller deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved). Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch. If the target has used Minimize, Steamroller ignores accuracy and deals double damage.

name: Steel Beam
description: The user fires a beam of steel that it collected from its entire body. This also damages the user.
effect: Steel Beam deals damage but the user loses 50% of its HP.

name: Steel Wing
description: The target is hit with wings of steel. This may also raise the user’s Defense stat.
effect: Steel Wing deals damage and has a 10% chance of raising the user's Defense by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Sticky Web
description: The user weaves a sticky net around the opposing team, which lowers their Speed stats upon switching into battle.
effect: Sticky Web sets up a sticky net around the opposing team, which lowers the Speed of Pokémon switching into battle by one stage. Raised Pokémon switching in are not affected. Raised Pokémon are any Flying types or those under the effects of Levitate, Magnet Rise or Telekinesis. Full details in glossary.

name: Stockpile
description: The user charges up power and raises both its Defense and Sp. Def stats. The move can be used three times.
effect: Stockpile raises the user's Defense and Special Defense by one stage each and charges up power for use with companion moves Spit Up or Swallow. Stockpile can be used up to three times before its companion moves, which will attack or recover HP respectively. The power of Spit Up and HP gained from Swallow varies depending on how many times Stockpile was used. After one of those moves is used, the user loses the Defense and Special Defense boosts.

name: Stoked Sparksurfer
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Stoked Sparksurfer is an Electric type Z-Move exclusive to Alolan Raichu. It is used with Thunderbolt.

name: Stomp
description: The target is stomped with a big foot. This may also make the target flinch.
effect: Stomp deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved). Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch. If the target has used Minimize, Stomp ignores accuracy and deals double damage.

name: Stomping Tantrum
description: Driven by frustration, the user attacks the target. If the user’s previous move has failed, the power of this move doubles.
effect: Driven by frustration, the user attacks the target. If the user's previous move has failed, the power of this move doubles.

name: Stone Edge
description: The user stabs the target from below with sharpened stones. Critical hits land more easily.
effect: Stone Edge deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio (1⁄8 instead of 1⁄16).

name: Stored Power
description: The user attacks the target with stored power. The more the user’s stats are raised, the greater the move’s power.
effect: Stored Power deals varying damage based on the user's stat increases. It starts at base power 20 and increases by 20 for each net stat boost the user has received, including Evasion and Accuracy. In other words the power is:

name: Storm Throw
description: The user strikes the target with a fierce blow. This attack always results in a critical hit.
effect: Storm Throw deals damage and always results in a critical hit, increasing its power to 90. However, Pokémon with the abilities Battle Armor or Shell Armor, or those under the effect of Lucky Chant are immune to critical hits so Storm Throw will hit them with base power 60.

name: Strange Steam
description: The user attacks the target by emitting steam. This may also confuse the target.
effect: May confuse opponent.

name: Strength
description: The target is slugged with a punch thrown at maximum power.
effect: Strength deals damage with no additional effect in battle.

name: Strength Sap
description: The user restores its HP by the same amount as the target’s Attack stat. It also lowers the target’s Attack stat.
effect: The user restores its HP by the same amount as the target's Attack stat. It also lowers the target's Attack stat.

name: String Shot
description: Opposing Pokémon are bound with silk blown from the user’s mouth that harshly lowers the Speed stat.
effect: String Shot lowers the target's Speed by two stages. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Struggle
description: This attack is used in desperation only if the user has no PP. It also damages the user a little.
effect: Only usable when all PP are gone. Hurts the user.

name: Struggle Bug
description: While resisting, the user attacks opposing Pokémon. This lowers the Sp. Atk stats of those hit.
effect: Struggle Bug deals damage and lowers the target's Special Attack by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Stuff Cheeks
description: The user eats its held Berry, then sharply raises its Defense stat.
effect: The user eats its held Berry, then sharply raises its Defense stat.

name: Stun Spore
description: The user scatters a cloud of numbing powder that paralyzes the target.
effect: Stun Spore paralyzes the target, if it hits. Paralyzed Pokémon have a 25% chance of not being able to attack, and their Speed is decreased by 50% (75% in Generations 1-6). Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.

name: Submission
description: The user grabs the target and recklessly dives for the ground. This also damages the user a little.
effect: Submission deals damage, but the user receives 1⁄4 of the damage it inflicts in recoil. In other words, if the attack does 100 HP damage to the opponent, the user will lose 25 HP.

name: Substitute
description: The user creates a substitute for itself using some of its HP. The substitute serves as the user’s decoy.
effect: Uses HP to creates a decoy that takes hits.

name: Subzero Slammer
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Subzero Slammer is the Ice type Z-Move, introduced in Pokémon Sun/Moon.

name: Sucker Punch
description: This move enables the user to attack first. This move fails if the target is not readying an attack.
effect: Sucker Punch deals damage and has a priority of +1. However, the move only works if the target uses a direct attack in the same turn. If the target is not preparing an attack, Sucker Punch will fail. Moves with a higher priority always go first, regardless of a Pokémon's speed. If two moves with the same priority are used, the faster Pokémon goes first as usual.

name: Sunny Day
description: The user intensifies the sun for five turns, powering up Fire-type moves. It lowers the power of Water-type moves.
effect: Sunny Day causes bright sunlight that lasts for 5 turns, and induces these additional effects:

name: Sunsteel Strike
description: The user slams into the target with the force of a meteor. This move can be used on the target regardless of its Abilities.
effect: Ignores the target's ability.

name: Super Fang
description: The user chomps hard on the target with its sharp front fangs. This cuts the target’s HP in half.
effect: Always takes off half of the opponent's HP.

name: Superpower
description: The user attacks the target with great power. However, this also lowers the user’s Attack and Defense stats.
effect: Superpower deals damage but lowers the user's Attack and Defense by one stage each after attacking. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Supersonic
description: The user generates odd sound waves from its body that confuse the target.
effect: Supersonic causes the target to become confused. Confused Pokémon have a 33% chance of hurting themselves each turn, for 1-4 attacking turns (50% chance in Generations 1-6). The damage received is as if the Pokémon attacks itself with a typeless 40 base power Physical attack. Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused. Soundproof also prevents this move.

name: Supersonic Skystrike
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Supersonic Skystrike is the Flying type Z-Move, introduced in Pokémon Sun/Moon.

name: Surf
description: The user attacks everything around it by swamping its surroundings with a giant wave.
effect: Surf deals damage. In double battles it will hit all Pokémon on the field; in triple battles it will hit all adjacent Pokémon. If the opponent is hidden underwater from using Dive, Surf will hit with double power.

name: Swagger
description: The user enrages and confuses the target. However, this also sharply raises the target’s Attack stat.
effect: Swagger confuses the target and raises its Attack by two stages. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. Confused Pokémon have a 33% chance of hurting themselves each turn, for 1-4 attacking turns (50% chance in Generations 1-6). The damage received is as if the Pokémon attacks itself with a typeless 40 base power Physical attack. Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused.

name: Swallow
description: The power stored using the move Stockpile is absorbed by the user to heal its HP. Storing more power heals more HP.
effect: Swallow recovers a varying amount of HP depending on how many times the user has used Stockpile. It recovers 25%, 50% or 100% of the user's maximum HP if the user stockpiled one, two or three times respectively. Swallow also removes the Defense and Special Defense boosts given through Stockpile.

name: Sweet Kiss
description: The user kisses the target with a sweet, angelic cuteness that causes confusion.
effect: Sweet Kiss causes the target to become confused. Confused Pokémon have a 33% chance of hurting themselves each turn, for 1-4 attacking turns (50% chance in Generations 1-6). The damage received is as if the Pokémon attacks itself with a typeless 40 base power Physical attack. Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused.

name: Sweet Scent
description: A sweet scent that harshly lowers opposing Pokémon’s evasiveness.
effect: Sweet Scent lowers the target's Evasion by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Swift
description: Star-shaped rays are shot at opposing Pokémon. This attack never misses.
effect: Swift deals damage and ignores changes to the Accuracy and Evasion stats. However, it will not hit Pokémon during the invulnerable stage of Bounce, Dig, Dive, Fly, Shadow Force or Sky Drop.

name: Switcheroo
description: The user trades held items with the target faster than the eye can follow.
effect: Switcheroo switches held items with the target. It does not require both Pokémon to be holding an item, in which case the item is simply given to the target or received from it. Switching items with wild Pokémon is permanent (received items are kept, given items are lost). All held items in Trainer battles and wi-fi/linked battles (including Battle Tower/Subway/Maison) are returned to their respective owners at the end of a battle. Pokemon with the ability Sticky Hold cannot have their held item removed. The Griseous Orb cannot be removed from Giratina; Type Plates cannot be removed from Arceus; Drives cannot be removed from Genesect; and Mega Stones cannot be removed from their respective Pokémon.

name: Swords Dance
description: A frenetic dance to uplift the fighting spirit. This sharply raises the user’s Attack stat.
effect: Swords Dance raises the user's Attack by two stages. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Synchronoise
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Synchronoise hits all adjacent Pokémon that share a type with the user. Dual type Pokémon match either of their types, so for example a Normal/Flying Pokémon using Synchronoise will hit a Flying/Dragon type.

name: Synthesis
description: The user restores its own HP. The amount of HP regained varies with the weather.
effect: User recovers HP. Amount varies with the weather.

name: Tackle
description: A physical attack in which the user charges and slams into the target with its whole body.
effect: Tackle is one of the most common and basic moves a Pokémon learns. It deals damage with no additional effects.

name: Tail Glow
description: The user stares at flashing lights to focus its mind, drastically raising its Sp. Atk stat.
effect: Tail Glow raises the user's Special Attack by three stages. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. Assuming no other stat changes, the first use of Tail Glow would raise Special Attack to 2.5× normal value, and the second to 4× (the maximum level).

name: Tail Slap
description: The user attacks by striking the target with its hard tail. It hits the target two to five times in a row.

name: Tail Whip
description: The user wags its tail cutely, making opposing Pokémon less wary and lowering their Defense stats.
effect: Tail Whip lowers the target's Defense by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Tailwind
description: The user whips up a turbulent whirlwind that ups the Speed stats of the user and its allies for four turns.
effect: Tailwind doubles the speed of all Pokémon in the user's party for 4 turns.

name: Take Down
description: A reckless, full-body charge attack for slamming into the target. This also damages the user a little.
effect: Take Down deals damage, but the user receives 1⁄4 of the damage it inflicted in recoil. In other words, if the attack does 100 HP damage to the opponent, the user will lose 25 HP.

name: Tar Shot
description: The user pours sticky tar over the target, lowering the target’s Speed stat. The target becomes weaker to Fire-type moves.
effect: Lowers the opponent's Speed and makes them weaker to Fire-type moves.

name: Taunt
description: The target is taunted into a rage that allows it to use only attack moves for three turns.
effect: Opponent can only use moves that attack.

name: Tearful Look
description: The user gets teary eyed to make the target lose its combative spirit. This lowers the target’s Attack and Sp. Atk stats.
effect: The user gets teary eyed to make the target lose its combative spirit. This lowers the target's Attack and Sp. Atk stats.

name: Teatime
description: The user has teatime with all the Pokémon in the battle. Each Pokémon eats its held Berry.
effect: Forces all Pokémon on the field to eat their berries.

name: Techno Blast
description: The user fires a beam of light at its target. The move’s type changes depending on the Drive the user holds.
effect: Techno Blast deals damage. Its type changes depending on the held Drive:

name: Tectonic Rage
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Tectonic Rage is the Ground type Z-Move, introduced in Pokémon Sun/Moon.

name: Teeter Dance
description: The user performs a wobbly dance that confuses the Pokémon around it.
effect: Teeter Dance causes all adjacent Pokémon to become confused. In single battles this is simply the opponent; in double/triple battles it includes all adjacent opponents and teammate(s). Confused Pokémon have a 33% chance of hurting themselves each turn, for 1-4 attacking turns (50% chance in Generations 1-6). The damage received is as if the Pokémon attacks itself with a typeless 40 base power Physical attack. Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused.

name: Telekinesis
description: This move can’t be used. It’s recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
effect: Telekinesis raises the target into the air for three turns, guaranteeing that all attacks against the target (except OHKO moves) will hit, regardless of Accuracy or Evasion. The target gains the usual benefits of being raised, e.g. immunity to Ground-type moves. More details, including when Telekinesis can't be used, are in the glossary. The effect is cancelled if the raised Pokémon is hit by Smack Down.

name: Teleport
description: The user switches places with a party Pokémon in waiting, if any. If a wild Pokémon uses this move, it flees.
effect: Teleport will always fail in a Trainer battle. In battles with wild Pokémon, Teleport allows the user to flee battles. Teleport also fails in wild battles if the user would normally be unable to flee due to a trapping move (e.g. Fire Spin) or ability (e.g. Arena Trap).

name: Thief
description: The user attacks and steals the target’s held item simultaneously. The user can’t steal anything if it already holds an item.
effect: Thief deals damage and steals the target's held item, if the user is not holding an item. Items stolen from wild Pokémon are kept after the battle ends, but items stolen from a Trainer's Pokémon are not. Items stolen from the player's Pokémon either by wild Pokémon or Trainer Pokémon are returned at the end of the battle. All held items in wi-fi/linked battles (including Battle Tower/Subway/Maison) are returned to their respective owners at the end of a battle. If the item would activate on attack (e.g. Focus Band), it does so before being stolen. If the item is consumable on attack (e.g. Focus Sash) then the item is consumed as normal and cannot be stolen. Pokemon with the ability Sticky Hold cannot have their held item removed. The Griseous Orb cannot be removed from Giratina; Type Plates cannot be removed from Arceus; Drives cannot be removed from Genesect; and Mega Stones cannot be removed from their respective Pokémon.

name: Thousand Arrows
description: This move also hits opposing Pokémon that are in the air. Those Pokémon are knocked down to the ground.
effect: Thousand Arrows deals damage and knocks the target(s) to the ground. Any raised Pokémon now become susceptible to Ground moves and Arena Trap. Raised Pokémon are any Flying types or those under the effects of Levitate, Magnet Rise or Telekinesis. Full details in glossary. Thousand Arrows can hit Pokémon using Fly or Bounce and will bring them back down to the ground, thus cancelling the moves. It can also hit Pokémon using Sky Drop but does not knock them to the ground. It does not knock down Substitutes but deals damage to the Substitute as normal.

name: Thousand Waves
description: The user attacks with a wave that crawls along the ground. Those it hits can’t flee from battle.
effect: Thousand Waves deals damage and prevents the target(s) from fleeing or switching out, as long as the user remains in battle.

name: Thrash
description: The user rampages and attacks for two to three turns. The user then becomes confused.
effect: The user of Thrash attacks for 2-3 turns, during which it cannot switch out, and then becomes confused. Confused Pokémon have a 33% chance of hurting themselves each turn, for 1-4 attacking turns (50% chance in Generations 1-6). The damage received is as if the Pokémon attacks itself with a typeless 40 base power Physical attack. If Thrash is disrupted (e.g. if the move misses or the user cannot attack due to paralysis) then it will stop and not cause confusion. Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused.

name: Throat Chop
description: The user attacks the target’s throat, and the resultant suffering prevents the target from using moves that emit sound for two turns.
effect: Throat Chop deals damage and prevents the target from using sound-based moves such as Hyper Voice for two turns.

name: Thunder
description: A wicked thunderbolt is dropped on the target to inflict damage. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
effect: Thunder deals damage and has a 30% chance of paralyzing the target. Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed. If used during rain, Thunder ignores accuracy. Conversely, if used during intense sunlight, its accuracy drops to 50%. Thunder can hit Pokémon during the first stage of Bounce, Fly or Sky Drop.

name: Thunder Fang
description: The user bites with electrified fangs. This may also make the target flinch or leave it with paralysis.
effect: Thunder Fang deals damage, has a 10% chance of paralyzing the target, and has a 10% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved). Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed. Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.

name: Thunder Punch
description: The target is punched with an electrified fist. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
effect: Thunder Punch deals damage and has a 10% chance of paralyzing the target. Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.

name: Thunder Shock
description: A jolt of electricity crashes down on the target to inflict damage. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
effect: Thunder Shock deals damage and has a 10% chance of paralyzing the target. Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.

name: Thunder Wave
description: The user launches a weak jolt of electricity that paralyzes the target.
effect: Thunder Wave paralyzes the opponent. Paralyzed Pokémon have a 25% chance of not being able to attack, and their Speed is decreased by 50% (75% in Generations 1-6). Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.

name: Thunderbolt
description: A strong electric blast crashes down on the target. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
effect: Thunderbolt deals damage and has a 10% chance of paralyzing the target. Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.

name: Tickle
description: The user tickles the target into laughing, reducing its Attack and Defense stats.
effect: Tickle lowers the target's Attack and Defense by one stage each. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Topsy-Turvy
description: All stat changes affecting the target turn topsy-turvy and become the opposite of what they were.
effect: Topsy-Turvy reverses the stat changes of the target Pokémon. For example, if the target has boosted their attack by 2 stages using Swords Dance, Topsy-Turvy will reduce their Attack down to -2 stages. Similarly, if the opponent has used Draco Meteor (lowering their Special Attack), Topsy-Turvy will raise their Special Attack to +2 stages.

name: Torment
description: The user torments and enrages the target, making it incapable of using the same move twice in a row.
effect: Opponent cannot use the same move in a row.

name: Toxic
description: A move that leaves the target badly poisoned. Its poison damage worsens every turn.
effect: Toxic causes the target to be badly poisoned. Pokémon that are badly poisoned will lose an increasing amount of HP at the end of each turn. The affected Pokémon will lose 1⁄16 of its maximum HP at the end of the first turn, which then increases by 1⁄16 each turn. In other words, they lose 1⁄16, 2⁄16, 3⁄16, 4⁄16 and so on. Toxic doesn't affect Pokémon already carrying a major status ailment, Pokémon behind a Substitute nor Poison- or Steel-type Pokémon.

name: Toxic Spikes
description: The user lays a trap of poison spikes at the feet of the opposing team. The spikes will poison opposing Pokémon that switch into battle.
effect: Toxic Spikes lays a trap of poisonous spikes around the foe, which poison Pokémon switching in to the opposing field. If used more than once, incoming Pokémon will be badly poisoned. The spikes will not poison any raised Pokémon, nor does it affect Poison or Steel types, nor Pokémon with the abilities Immunity or Magic Guard.
